column2: Skill required:Reporting - Microsoft Power BI  Designation:Service Management Analyst  Job Location:Gurugram  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? The Business Reporting and Governance vertical helps to deploy and deliver robust tracking mechanism for SLA/KPI or any other operations on a day to day basis. Business Analyst to support the Global Sourcing and Procurement Service Team. GSPS is a division under the Client's Finance organization that strives to provide world class sourcing and procurement services in the Professional Services, Business Services, and Technology services categories. These category sourcing teams value-hunt on behalf of Client businesses and negotiate quality services, goods, and products from third party suppliers at the best commercial rates possible. Each category team has their own cost reduction savings target and have a number of initiatives to achieve them. The life-cycle of a savings initiative follows a prescribed process which is managed by the GSPS Savings Governance team (which sits outside the category teams) utilizing the Archer System. The role will require for you to work on Microsoft Power BI to help visualize data and share discoveries and collaborate in intuitive new ways.  What are we looking for? Experience in synthesizing and preparing information for use in executive level summaries, presentations, and dashboards using Excel, Tableau and PowerPoint  Developing/enhancing and manage agreed reporting and dashboard refresh processes with adhering to agreed SLAs  Applying quality control, data validation, and cleansing processes to data sources  Strong analytic skills and ability to pay attention and follow detailed financial data, should be able to articulate issues with data records and how to resolve them.  Knowledge of sourcing practices, documentation (i.e. MSA's, SOW's, amendments, RFP's) and jargon (i.e., supply side savings, demand side savings, volume discounts, rebates, credits etc.) and ability to understand the rationale for how a savings/cost reduction is being achieved by a category sourcing team.  Ability to prioritize projects, manage multiple competing priorities and drive projects to completion under tight deadlines  Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders  Experience working with large, multi-dimensional data sets and developing different types of visualizations  Microsoft PowerPoint  Microsoft SharePoint Portal Development  Microsoft Access  Microsoft Excel  Microsoft Power BI Roles and Responsibilities BA's primary responsibility will be to support the GSPS reporting and data analytics requirements by inspecting, cleansing, and modelling data with the goal of providing useful information to support decision making. BA would also support Savings Governance team on all savings related activities including data management, savings forecast and trend analytics, governance reviews/rejections/approvals, program training and education, and prepare/develop executive and team level progress reporting.

column2: Experience                                         3 - 5 years                               Qualification                             MBA from a reputed institute / Masters in Financial Engineering / CA                                 Role & Responsibilities:                                         Monitor & analyse client portfolios in terms of credit exposures (CE, PE, EE, etc.), risk profiles and margin levels and provide commentary on the drivers for the risk exposure and daily moves                             Quantify and provide appropriate haircut levels for securities financing transactions, likewise calculate initial margin for all OTC trades with hedge funds and other clients.                             Participate in margin methodology development, enhancement of existing margin models and their documentation                             Manage risks for the firm s portfolio of collateralized transactions through relevant portfolio analysis using different parameters such as credit risk metrics, VaR, stress & liquidation scenarios, etc. and its reporting.                             Understand the rules & regulations of various regulatory bodies (such as JFSA, PRA, BaFin &, SEC) applicable for Regulatory Credit Risk Exposure & Capital calculations and ensure its correct implementation for the trade portfolios.                              Work with various risk managers and other stakeholders, internal audit, model validation group to address their requests for additional analysis based on specific needs as they arise. column2: As an Associate Competitive Intelligence & Strategy Analyst, you will work cross-functionally to support Anaplan s global strategy and competitive intelligence efforts          You will assist with in-depth competitor analysis, data gathering, and will be comfortable utilizing our Anaplan competitive model to uncover insights and trends within the data      Additionally, you will analyze large volumes of data to extract competitive and market insights, which will inform go-to-market (GTM) strategy and product decisions      You will also collaborate with GTM Strategy & Planning internal customers such as Marketing, Sales, Presales, and Product, assisting in data and competitor analysis to help build collateral that equips the field with Anaplan s value differentiators relative to competitors        You will possess excellent communication skills, seek to understand the perspectives of participants in meetings, speak up to drive conversations, and form strong relationships with our internal partners          This position is fully remote in India      Preference will be given to candidates located near Anaplan offices in the country          Gain a comprehensive understanding of Anaplan s product capabilities and the competitive landscape across Finance/Workforce, Sales, and Supply Chain planning        Partner with your peers and the Solutions & Industry Marketing team to develop battlecards and other competitive content and assets        Respond to ad-hoc questions and requests from the field regarding competitors and best practices in competitive selling        Perform competitive and market analysis and analyse internal competitive data to develop insights        Analyse existing data sets for opportunities to improve competitive insights and data collection, then drive updates as appropriate      Proactively publish competitive news and intelligence to internal collaboration tools        Manage the rationalization and cleanup of opportunity data from Salesforce to build a credible dataset that supports competitive win/loss metrics and various business functions        Analyse and review trends from modelling to advise on GTM sales plays, marketing campaigns, and product roadmap decisions        Collaborate with Customer Marketing to develop competitive win customer case studies        Develop, support, and present detailed presentations and conclusions for leadership and internal teams        Accommodate ad-hoc requests from the organization                    Your Qualifications:                          Bachelor s degree in a field that emphasizes analytical and communication skills, such as Business, Economics, or a related discipline.      2 years of experience in competitive intelligence, preferably within technology / SaaS, or connected planning / xP&A domains.          Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and experience with Salesforce as well as project management tools      Strong analytical skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects attentively and meet deadlines.              Experience working cross-functionally with an entrepreneurial and agile mindset in a dynamic and fast-paced environment preferred.          Proficiency in analytics, BI, and visualization tools like Tableau or similar with advanced skills in data analysis techniques such as statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and data mining.              Familiarity with market research methods in both primary (qualitative and quantitative) and secondary research; understanding of market segmentation and competitive positioning strategies.              Experience as a user or consultant for Anaplan or other connected planning / xP&A software.        Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion, and belonging.      Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.      Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible, and then followed up via written communication.

column1: Data Science And Analytics Consultant- Manager
column2: NeenOpal is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. If you are someone who thrives on ambiguity, is a problem solver, and yet delivers value to clients, please apply for the position Position Description : We are currently hiring Technical Project Lead/ Managers for our Analytics / Decision Science practice 1. As an Analytics Consultant at NeenOpal, you will help our clients define, design and implement complex data solutions for mission-critical information capabilities. 2. You will lead teams delivering big data, data science, data engineering, data warehousing, governance, and data visualization projects, making sure that the projects get delivered on time - while ensuring customer delight. Please note that you must be willing to pull up your sleeves and do some heavy lifting to get a product or service off the ground in a startup environment. This means you will be juggling different roles and being a master of all things when it comes to analytics, including coding. The role needs a person who can solve anything quicker than anyone else. If the deadline is on fire, you need to work side by side with the team and code or run tests if they require your help. Responsibilities : 1. Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals. 2. Leverage and customize NeenOpal's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project. 3. Answer customers' questions, track deliveries and address customer complaints. 4. Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery. 5. Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions. 6. Make presentations and recommendations to clients on various deliverables in each project 7. Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics. 8. Contribute to NeenOpal's development of new solutions and analytical models. 9. Recruit, manage, and mentor a team of analysts The exact nature of duties, as well as the salary and compensation package, will be commensurate with experience and salary history. Requirements : 1. Past experience in Client Handling and Project Delivery is must. 2. Analytics domain experience is preferred. 3. Experience in Cloud based technologies like- AWS/Azure is must. 4. Microsoft / Amazon/ Google certifications is bonus. Required Skills & Experience : 1. An MBA Degree. 2. Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, R, and ML, and being able to quickly master new tools/packages when needed. 3. Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills, and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language. 4. Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results. 5. Ability to lead projects and teams 6. Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and/or optimization techniques 7. Exposure to / experience working with large data sets. 8. Working knowledge of market-leading data visualization tools such as - Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc is desired Benefits : NeenOpal is a global management consulting firm with a unique and specialized focus on Data Science. We provide services across the whole value chain of an organization - Digital Strategy, Sales & Marketing, Supply Chain & Logistics as well as Finance. With offices across Bangalore and New York - the company works with some of the leading enterprises as well as growth-stage startup clients. Read more about us on our website: https://www.neenopal.com/ You'll have a blast doing it in our fun, passionate environment.

Preferred Qualifications:         bachelors degree or equivalent work experience     In depth knowledge of required language pitch, tones, rhythm, intent, etc     Ability to have fun at work while bringing your authentic self     Linguistics or computational linguistic background     Experience in language technology including speech     Proficient in multiple required languages     Analytical Skills     Attention to Detail     Business Intelligence (BI)     Native Language Proficiency     Operational Excellence     Research and Data Analysis                       Tasks           The Data Annotation Specialist performs data annotation and analysis using native language skills and cultural knowledge to capture linguistic nuances with high fidelity.     Maintains a high level of accuracy, quality, and consistency in data annotation.     Works to understand the requirements and specifications of the data annotation projects and creates work instructions based on those requirements.     Identifies internal opportunities to develop new projects and     improve current ones. Recognizes root problems (eg, root-cause analysis), gathers requirements and evangelizes proposed solutions to broader team.     Grows ability to track individual success criteria and performance metrics related to quality and throughput etc     Cooperates with project leads to execute on landing deliverables. Maintains the rhythm of business (ROB) during plan execution to ensure global alignment.     Works across teams and centers to ensure all projects/initiative requirements are understood and can be met.     Adapts communication style and storytelling strategy according to audience and business needs.     Familiarizes self with guidelines to identify quality problems, and/or discover insights into the data. Contributes to the exploration and development of guidelines/work instructions.     Develops advanced understanding of guidelines and identifies gaps and when they should be used.     Understands and follows ethics and privacy policies when contributing to development of guidelines.     Adheres to Microsofts privacy policy related to utilizing and working with data.     Maintains high standard of data protection and security, follows standardized processes to prevent any information leakage or breach that could compromise the quality and reliability of products and services and minimizes exposure to risk.     Demonstrates personal ownership through following Security & Privacy guidelines, immediately reporting incidents using the appropriate channels, and completes all security training.     Adheres to policy to protect Microsoft and customers. Discovers non-conformance and escalates to management.     Follows individual program guidelines based on corporate policies and processes.             Data Annotation Specialists:         Use in house tools to transcribe and annotate data for various projects. A few examples may be providing transcription (text) for audio clips or annotating text or images to verify certain types of data.     Go through content (online and offline), extract information, provide needed information through tools with high accuracy and consistency.     Perform quality evaluation of transcription and annotation results produced by different sources.     Collaborate with team members on day-to-day problem solving and projects assigned by managers.     Data Annotation Specialists will come across offensive, sensitive, or objectionable material and may be required to work with this type of content to help train our AI models for the protection of Microsoft's customers.          Data Annotation Specialists are comfortable understanding data as it relates to :         Sentiment: The emotional intonation and other subjective implications behind keywords and phrases.     Intent: The human intent, or the user s end goal, behind different statements. Semantic: Understanding exactly what the meaning is behind what users are seeking     Use deductive reasoning based on information provided in contextual turns to ensure    labelling is of the highest quality

column2: The Sr People Data Reporting Associate is part of a newly created HR Reporting team which falls under the HR People Insights team. This team is responsible for ad hoc and scheduled reports which will be approved according to a data governance approval matrix and delivered in a secure fashion. Reports may be required on a one-off basis or an ongoing scheduled basis. Key stakeholders/requestors include groups inside and outside HR and key approved partners and stakeholders outside UKG. Reference databases include UKG Pro, Visier, and other key HR systems.  This position will:  Utilize BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms to extract and transform HR data from multiple sources including HRIS (Human Resources Information System), ATS (Applicant Tracking System), and other relevant databases.  Select and design reports to provide the most appropriate HR fields to satisfy the user requests after reviewing and ensuring appropriate approvals are in place while meeting stated SLAs  Develop and maintain automated processes for data extraction, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.  Determine when reports should be created for self service, reoccurring or one time. Job responsibilities New requests  Review assigned tickets to ensure complete understanding of business request including timing and requested content  Review requested content and requestor role to ensure data governance guidelines are met  For requests that do not meet the existing requirements, reject with requirement to provide more business need/content for escalation review  Determine if content/reports already exist in self-service or existing report or needs to be created  Design BI or other report to pull appropriate data and ensure QA completed and SLA met  Provide to customer in secure fashion with scheduled follow-up where needed; upload to external sites or provide to vendors where needed.  Ensure report is stored and labeled properly for continued use/review Existing reports new users/new fields  Review assigned tickets to ensure complete understanding of business request including timing and requested content  Review content and requestor to ensure data governance guidelines are met  Update reports with users/fields where needed Scheduled (Recurring) reports  Review scheduled reports quarterly and reach out to owner to check for modifications  Ensure ongoing reports are being sent as scheduled to the appropriate users  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in HR, Business Administration, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field.  Proven experience as a Reporting Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role, preferably within an HR function.  Proficiency in BI tools such as Cognos, Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.  Strong data management/manipulation skills  Experience working with HRIS and ATS systems is desirable; experience with UKG Pro desired  At least 3 years experience in Cognos reporting, Power BI visualization to deliver enterprise scale reports and dashboards or other Major BI platforms.  Knowledge of SQL database language and/or exposure to programming languages (R, SAS, Python, etc.)  Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and quality.  Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team environment.  Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines/SLAs  In depth knowledge and experience with MS Excel  3+ years experience in an operational reporting or analysis environment with a bachelors degree or in a related discipline in HR, L&D, Systems Analysis, IT or Finance or Analytics.  EEO Statement

column2: UKG is looking for a self-driven, process minded Business Systems Internal Control Analyst with an enterprise lens to join our GDS Business System Solutions team. As a Business Applications Analyst on the GDS Business Systems Solutions team, you will help develop and execute a critical, comprehensive internal control system that is aligned to UKG goals, KPIs and will support quality E2E systems and processes for our effective scaling and growth. In addition to supporting the framework and implementation of the End-to-End internal controls system, you will be responsible for supporting a proactive auditing function to identify process and workflow inconsistencies that could lead to a loss of data integrity, revenue leakage, inaccurate delivery tool provisioning and customer credits. Leveraging your enterprise-wide internal audit function, you will assess the current state, identify gaps, and recommend end user process and system workflow changes to align to Internal control efficiency and OKRs. With the significant layer of cross functional reliance upon effective system workflows and data quality, you will partner with the GDS BSS System owners and Cross functional business leaders and reporting SMEs. This cross functional collaboration will ensure that we understand how GDS BSS system data is used to enable us to drive system and process governance and changes that will have a positive outcome. With successful GDS Business System Solutions Internal Controls, we will: Leveraging data driven business decisions to drive the UKG1 harmonization roadmap, consolidating and/or removing disparate legacy systems and processes creating a unified, efficient operational UKG. Optimize the efficiency of business processes and standard operating procedures through proactive monitoring, solutioning and change management, resulting in faster throughput without compromising quality across the GDS Business System Solutions: Salesforce, PSA and Project Management tool provisioning.  Qualifications BA or BS degree or equivalent practical experience  Minimum 2-3 years of business process and data analytics  Power BI and Excel skills with knowledge of data transformation and data modeling. Highly skilled in using power query and high proficiency with DAX and M coding languages required.  Proficiency in building complex reports across Open Air, Salesforce, and IBM Cognos preferred. Analytical mindset for evaluating data and identifying trends, patterns, anomalies, and outliers. Analytical and problem-solving skills to include ability understand databases, data structures to facilitate auditing and reporting.  Strong desire to identify data gaps and creative thinking in pattern analysis and data forensics to identify audit gaps and root cause.  Strong attention to details, with ability to drill down into very tactical considerations to ensure accuracy in deliverables.  Self-starter and autonomous, ability to multi-task, work independently, prioritize and get things done.  Excellent customer service, stakeholder management, oral and written communication skills Strong background and understanding of SaaS business model preferred. Financial and business acumen preferred.

column2: Role To help in building the detailed process maps, following the BPMN mapping standards, based on defined timelines. Review the controls in processes and identify process gaps across the EQ Group. This role will be critical in process standardization and re-engineering. Work with the Risk team on Organization Risk and Control Management. The role to be based out of Chennai location. Business Function Process CoE team work closely with the EQ India Operation and EQ Group functions across UK and US in driving the initiatives to optimize end-to-end processes across the organization. Estabilishing a culture of continuous improvement and helping the organization to manage the operations efficiently through robust control frameworks and process standardization. Core Duties and Responsibilities Understand and create standardized process flows using BPMN standards. Identify opportunities to optimize end-to-end processes across the organization as per BPMN standards. Work closely with the operations and transition team, to understand the migrating processes. Review the process to identify potential gaps while coming up with process flows. Ensure that control measures are effectively integrated into daily process flows. While mapping the processes, look for the effectiveness of controls, make recommendations for improvements as needed. Perform trend analysis to anticipate potential challenges and implement preventive measures to mitigate. Support the operations and risk teams in implementing robust control frameworks to mitigate identified risks. Periodically review with Operations to update the revised processes and controls that the processes have underwent. Take lead in implementing continuous improvement intiatives, proactively identify opportunities for enhancement. Ensure the implementation of reviewed and revised processes and controls by the respective stakeholders. Competencies and Experience The candidate should posses the following experience, skills and behaviours: Bachelors degree in Business administration, Finance, Information Technology, or a relevant field. 2 to 5 years of experience with minimum 1 to 3 years as a Business Process Analyst or in a similar role. Hands on experience in using business process mapping tools is required (e.g., IBM Blueworks, Aris, Igraffx). Understanding of business process management and notation (BPMN) methodologies and tools. Proficiency in process modeling and analysis techniques is a plus (e.g., BPMN, Six Sigma, Lean). In-depth knowledge about work/process standardization, risk identification and controls is a plus. Understanding of process automation, workflow management, or business process management systems is preferred.

column2: Vistas Engineering organization is working to make our company one of the worlds most well-known and successful data-driven companies       The cross-functional team includes analysts, software and data engineers, architects, data scientists, product owners, and more - all passionate about providing Vista with solutions, insights and tools to develop products and services customer love     Vista Engineering team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers               We work in close collaboration with our partners in the business, Customer Service, Product Development, and Marketing as we embark on an exciting journey to upgrade our customer service with advanced analytics     Vista is a leader in custom designs and professional marketing for small businesses and offers phenomenal customer service     Our goal is to empower our teams with innovative data analytics solutions and actionable insights, enabling them to deliver an exceptional customer experience and drive continuous improvement                      What You Will Do:                       Be a central part of our mission to become the expert design and marketing partner for small businesses    by     helping teams across Vista to understand their impact on customer experience and how they can become more customer-centric.               As an analytics partner, be an integral part of the CARE Product Development team    that creates innovative solutions to create excellent support and a world-class experience for our customers, specialists, and designers, including AI/GenAI-driven solutions.               Explore, analyze and model data    from various contact center data sources to create holistic reporting of the performance, drivers, and trends of Contact Center Operations and to understand the impact of improvement drivers for customer experience and efficiency as well as to identify improvement opportunities for the Product teams.               Deliver data insights in actionable, informative and visually exciting user interfaces,    enabling stakeholders to understand current performance and trends, key drivers of experience as well as prioritized areas for action.               Design, give advice on, and execute a/b/n tests    to optimize the customer experience, analyze results to provide insightful recommendations to the business, and build self-service experimentation capabilities for the Product team.               Coach more junior analysts    and guide their work to deliver best-in-class analytics for stakeholders.               Collaborate with CARE, analytics, engineering, and other business colleagues from all over the world    who understand the value of a truly diverse and cross-functional workplace. column2: Catastrophe Modelers quantify catastrophe loss potential of risk exposures carried by different entities, especially Insurers.     The incumbent will be responsible for modeling insurance exposures for large, complex insurance books having complex insurance and/or reinsurance terms using leading catastrophe models like RMS RiskLink, AIR Touchstone, CoreLogic RQE as well as proprietary WTW models.     This includes preparing the data for analysis, data scrubbing as well as data mining, generating probabilistic loss estimates using catastrophe models, creating and visualizing exposure and loss summaries, conducting loss feasibility studies to validate modeled losses, estimating the impact of model change, optimizing the reinsurance structure, etc. It also includes serving as the epicenter of all modeling action by coordinating between different offices and stakeholders in order to ensure modeling and client satisfaction goals are met.     The ability to lead modeling efforts for top clients and finding innovative and bespoke solutions to complex problems is a key expectation at this level. The candidate is expected to use very advanced Catastrophe Modeling expertise in order to tackle any kind of challenge and guide other team members as and when needed. The right candidate should be skilled at training junior analysts and reviewing their work.     Project planning/management and complex problem solving are some of the key skills needed in this role. The incumbent will be expected to continuously upskill themselves and do value add to the process/projects on a consistent basis.     The candidate is expected to work on projects that include dynamic deliverables with shifting timelines, involving multiple stakeholders. The models and technology are also continuously evolving. As such, the candidate should display great alacrity and agility and should be an excellent team player who can adapt to changing circumstances and the dynamic nature of demands/challenges.     Scope of the Role     The incumbent will be responsible for leading renewal, intermittent and RFP modeling on highly complex accounts; the modeling span typically ranges from 6 weeks for entry level accounts for this position to 6 months for top accounts.     Responsibilities     Model input preparation - Includes data preparation as well as data scrubbing using SQL/Excel.     Analyzing the exposures - Includes geocoding the exposures, implementing modeling assumptions accurately in the modeling process, ensuring correct model and peril settings, etc. in order to quantify insurers' catastrophe loss potential.     Generating reports - Includes using internal tools like iFM, WorkFlowManager for creating exposure as well as loss summary reports, visualizing various statistics by creating maps using SpatiaKey, ArcGIS, etc.     Running proprietary models - Running customized peril analysis using WTW proprietary models.     Model Sensitivity Analysis - Testing the change in model output with change in input parameters.     Answering SRQ - using internal tools and modeled losses for answering Natural Catastrophe as well as Terrorism portions of SRQs.     Validating losses - conducting loss feasibility studies to validate modeled losses.     Model change management - stay updated with changes in models and conduct studies to estimate the impact on modeled client losses.     Leading RFPs - Utilize the extensive modeling experience in leading RFPs where prospects usually do not share any data.     Optimizing reinsurance - Model different reinsurance structures to identify the optimum structure in order to maximize client profitability.     Mentoring - Mentor specific junior analysts in the team dedicatedly in order to minimize their learning curve.     Training - Participate in training programs in order to train new recruits.     Knowledge share - Conduct regular knowledge share sessions within and/or outside the team     Leading eVENT Response - help coordinate the live eVENT response, generating reports and managing client interactions on timely basis     The incumbent will be expected to co-ordinate and communicate with the onshore lead analyst as and when needed in order to discuss the progress made as well as any items of significance seek feedback and suggestions     The incumbent? is also expected to co-ordinate and communicate effectively between multiple offices and stakeholders on a regular basis in order to discuss project plan and resource allocation discuss the progress made as well as any items of significance seek feedback and suggestions share insights into modelled losses and reports act as the main coordinator between multiple stakeholders     Qualifications     Academic qualifications and experience required for the role     Graduate/Post-Graduate in any Quantitative Discipline, preferably, but not limited to, athematics/ Statistics/ Economics, Engineering, etc.     Experience     Senior Analyst ??6 to 8 years

column2: As a      consultant in data management,     you will be working with Tableau,         PowerBI     ,         Adverity     ,      Google Data Studio and Google Cloud to      support the team, in building engaging visualisation of data, as well      developing      data pipelines     and solutions to automatically QA the data for the client     .              You will sit in a data/tech and analytics team, which is dedicated to      Airbnb     , howe'ver you will also be part of the BI/engineering central community.              It is important to be a      self starter     and thinker.          The work will be to provide an automated solution for all      reporting     across the Airbnb account     , creating the data pipelines using our in-house proprietary platforms     and      design     ing     , build     ing     and maintain a wide variety of reports     to provide updates and insights to our client.          It is important that the data we provide to our clients is correct, so at first, manual QA will be necessary to ensure everything is matching across the      data sets. In parallel it is important to create automated QA solutions so that we have peace of mind that the data running is correct and flagged when there are issues with taxonomy     , data quality and structure     .              Once the pipelines      and QA      are in place, you will lead on the      data visualisation      build     ,     this will follow a round of requirements gathering sessions with the client stakeholders to provide recommendations for the      design of the visualizations and delivery of the data to      demonstrate to      the client         that      Essencem     edia     c     om s campaigns are effective.              The project will be delivered in a few stages - once the data pipelines are set up, you will provide      excel based reporting to remove the need for the planning and activation teams to create them. The build of the dashboards will come after that, creating them market by market for digital     data only then will follow with offline data.          Your      ability to work on raw data pipelines and to manipulate data in databases is      important, as well as the understanding of the way the data needs to be calculated.             You have an analytical mindset, a good level of mathematical and data handling ability and a passion for solving problems. Previous experience with      data visualization tools is important (Tableau/     PowerBI     /Looker etc)     .          Line Management              Reports to the      SAD- Data Management             3 best things about the job             you'll have access to the latest and greatest in cloud and dashboarding      technologies         Continuous learning, autonomy room for development with the best in the industry.         you'll be working in a close knit, friendly team who are there to support you at every stage of your career. column2: The role is responsible for data analysis, quality assurance, quality scoring of data products and solutions for the organization including participating in design, architecture, and implementation of data, BI, and analytics solutions. Additionally, the role involves close coordination with the technology, product mgmt. and the business teams with a focus on the business user.             Job Requirements             Relevant Experience       6+ years overall experience     3+ years of experience in Data Warehousing & BI leading business requirements analysis, customer engagement, development and/or data analysis. Data Architecture experience would be preferred.     Technical Know-how/Tools used     Perform Quality assurance for enterprise data analytics products and solution.     Develop and implement data quality standards, policies, and procedures to ensure consistent and reliable data across systems.     Conduct thorough data quality assessments and analysis to identify inconsistencies, inaccuracies, and anomalies in datasets.     Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to define data quality requirements and standards for new and existing datasets.     Design and execute data quality tests and validation processes to assess the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data.     Develop data quality metrics and scoring methodologies to measure and monitor data quality performance.     Generate data quality reports and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.     Investigate root causes of data quality issues and collaborate with relevant teams to implement corrective actions.     Experience with BI tools (Hyperion, PowerBI, Looker) is preferred.     Expertise in SQL stored procedures and conducting performance tuning/optimization is preferred.     Snowflake certified professionals are preferred.     Certified professionals in Agile, Product, Project Management are preferred.       Behavioural Skills       Ability to work in ambiguous situations by virtue of organizational knowledge, insights, past experience and support teams to adapt their ways of working.     Ability to create appropriate framework for creative thinking and drive agile mindset and flexible ways of working for teams.     Ability to ensure inclusiveness in ways of working with the team, acknowledging, and uncovering unconscious biases, creating a trusting workplace.     Ability to drive strategy and adapt to new information and industry changes and shift team priorities when needed.     Ability to demonstrate strong knowledge of business strategies, metrics and trends impacting the achievement of business and enterprise goals in decision making.     Ability to map explicit, implicit and unstated needs of both existing & potential stakeholders leading to tailored delivery, continued relevance and higher satisfaction along with building trust and long-term relationship with stakeholders.     Ability to seek and provide feedback on performance and behaviour, using it for self-awareness, development and shared learning.     Ability to champion systems for shared learning, knowledge management and preservation, and suggests ways to incorporate learning across teams and engage in continuous learning.     Ability to set and act to reach challenging goals for self and others, with tactful prioritization and planning to attain goals and achieve exceptional performance and results.     Ability to make systematic effort to seamlessly obtain needed data or feedback for logical and data-driven solutioning and uses lateral thinking to solve problems.     Ability to encourage co-creation and leverage connections made to deliver results and respect conflicting opinions.     Ability to foster contextualized two-way communication with diverse audiences using the appropriate mode (verbal/written), channels and communication formats to drive strategic objectives, foster active listening                       Roles & Responsibilities           Operational Excellence       1. Manage the end-to-end execution of data quality assessment, monitoring and QA in collaboration with business and technology teams!     2. Perform required data analysis for the data/product solutions in the pipeline across the organization.     3. Provide structure to ambiguous environments and resolve problems through technical & functional-based solutions as applicable.         Stakeholder Management       1. Interact with the business users & technology team on a frequent basis to understand their quality requirements.     2. Keep abreast of the outstanding issues by regularly communicating with business users/technology team to update on the pending backlogs, identify the bottlenecks, and address them for a speedy resolution.     3. column2: The Consultant will be involved in a short-term project that aims to assess the relevance of cost-benefit analysis in prioritising nature-based solutions for coastal adaptation. This work will be in the climate change adaptation domain within the Climate, Environment, and Sustainability sector.         Responsibilities         Evaluate the requirements for coastal adaptation in selected cities and develop a comprehensive cost-benefit analysis (CBA) methodology based on ecosystem services assessment.         Develop CBA scenarios (without NbS, alternative NbS, phased/partial NbS, planned NbS) for the two contexts, based on pre-selected list of NbS typologies.         Compute total costs of interventions, and the benefits generated, payback period, net present value, benefit to cost ratio, and aggregation of costs and benefits in different periods to a single value using a discount rate.         Contribute to NbS repository with new, relevant NbS economic evaluation methods (if any), associated policies. and publications.         Generate data, presentation, and explainer for the CBA results.         Qualifications       Masters degree in economics, environmental economics, financial economics or any discipline of social sciences with sound command over statistical skills.           ?       Experience       At least 3 years of experience working on development-related issues and a good understanding of urban infrastructure and cost-benefit analysis.         Skill Set         Applied knowledge of cost-benefit analysis and other economic evaluation methods for nature-based solutions.         Strong understanding of environmental economics.         Strong quantitative and analytical skills, and prior CBA experience.         Critical-thinking skills: systematic interpretation of findings to contribute to innovative research methodology.         Ability to work independently and within the larger framework of a team.         Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point), Matlab/Python.

column2: We re now looking for a    Research Analyst    to join our    Canalys    team based in Bengaluru, India office.      Canalys is looking for a Research Analyst to support our fast-growing and highly respected worldwide market intelligence services, used by the world s leading technology companies. The successful applicant will be based in our Bengaluru, India office and will be responsible for data analysis and presentation of market trends and insights.     The recruit will work in an experienced global team, providing support across our cybersecurity, data center infrastructure and networking services, as well as custom research projects.     The primary role will involve data analysis and research, as well as working on a series of reports, presentations, databases, and client inquiries.     Responsibilities :        Working with the team to contribute toward global research needs, including databases, reports and projects, as well as keep up to date on industry trends.     Processing quarterly data, forecasting and analysis within Canalys Cybersecurity and Infrastructure research services as well as custom research projects.     Taking responsibility for reports on vendor performance, global market trends, macro-economic forces, etc.     Conducting face-to-face and desk research on areas of cybersecurity, networking, servers and storage. Insight. Innovation. Impact. www.canalys.com     Collecting and consolidating information across a range of supporting databases including financial results, key economic metrics and business demographics.     Engaging with clients, including presenting to clients on a regular basis, as well as responding to client inquiries.      Contributing to social media output highlighting Canalys research.        Qualifications            1-2 years of relevant experience preferably within a channel, IT networking, IT infrastructure or market research role.     A Bachelor s Degree, preferably with a specialization in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, engineering, commerce and/or data science     Excellent Microsoft Office skills, including Excel, PowerPoint and Word are essential.     Skills in data analysis, manipulation and visualization preferred. Experience with Power BI is a bonus.     Show a strong aptitude for technology. Be acquainted with current market trends and a have a keen understanding of the future direction of the market.     Basic understanding of company s financial statements.     Knowledge of database tools such as Access will be a bonus. \     Ability to work both independently and in small teams.     Demonstrate an understanding of our company values of Accountability, Quality, Passion, Care, Being Flexible and Thinking Globally         What makes a good candidate?          Hunger: excited to learn about the technology industry and learn new skills.     Independent: learn by doing, proactively seeking guidance and using initiative to complete tasks.     Tech-focused: interested in technology and can demonstrate practical use.     Analytical: know how to work with data, in terms of collecting, processing and interpreting it.     Reliable: self-disciplined to meet deadlines and can multi-task.     Social: able to forge relationships with people face-to-face and virtually

column2: Gartner is currently seeking a Senior Specialist for its Quantitative Insights COE     This is an individual contributor role and is aligned to HR practice     This team leverages proprietary quantitative data and frameworks to offer original, actionable insights to key business problems facing senior executives across industries     The selected candidate will be responsible for supporting/co-leading research content development as well as collaborating with global research teams to produce published content, presentations, and webinars     The role provides excellent exposure to a full range of topics related to the management of Human Resource function as well as the opportunity to apply and further develop statistical concepts in research             What you will do:             This position is for individuals interested in conducting quantitative research, data analyses and reporting insights using proprietary benchmarking and survey data to create/author compelling research products for Gartner clients             Primary responsibilities include:               Root cause underlying assumptions behind client mission critical priorities and hypothesize solutions. column2: About Gartner Digital Markets: Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to empower organizations to accelerate growth by helping them embrace the right technology and services.Gartner Digital Markets is the worlds largest platform for finding software and services. With more than 100 million annual visitors across four buyer destinationsCapterra, GetApp, Software Advice, and UpCityand 70 localized sites, Gartner Digital Markets helps software and service providers build their brand, capture demand, and understand their market. As the only destination for software and services driven by independent, objective research and verified customer reviews, we help connect providers with in-market buyers to fuel growth across the full funnel.For candidates interested in taking their next career step, Gartner Digital Markets offers the best of two worldsthe stability and resources of a large, established organization combined with the fast pace and excitement of working for a dynamic growth business. Our team is on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always transforming, providing an incredible opportunity for you to grow and learn throughout your career. What You Will Do: Utilize analytics to support Gartner Digital Markets mission to be the leading resource for software buyers and sellers. Lead the initiatives with a team of data analysts to deliver actionable insights and recommendations that drive product-let growth and enhance the user experience of our vendor-facing products. Collaborate with product managers, engineers, data scientists and other stakeholders to define key metrics, KPIs, and success criteria for our products. Design and implement data collection and tracking mechanisms to gather relevant data and ensure data integrity and accuracy. Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, insights and opportunities for optimization and improvement in our vendor-facing products. Roles & Responsibilities Tripadvisor Analytics is seeking a Senior Analyst who can partner with numerous stakeholder teams, provide analytics and measurement expertise across key business categories, and contribute to a growing analytics team dedicated to generating high-quality, actionable data insights. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis and creating intuitive Tableau dashboards, maintaining data pipelines, and possess a basic knowledge of Python. Responsibilities Data Analysis and Insight Generation Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive informed business decisions. column2: The Data Analyst (Excel Specialist) is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data using Microsoft Excel to provide insights and support decision-making within the firm     This role involves working extensively with Excel functions, formulas, and tools to manipulate, visualize, and analyze data effectively       Responsibilities:     1.Data Collection and Preparation: Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and completeness. Use Excel functions and features to preprocess and format data for analysis.   2.Data Analysis: Perform data analysis using advanced Excel functions (eg, VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS) to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.   3.Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and informative charts, graphs, and pivot tables in Excel to summarize and present analysis results effectively.   4.Dashboard Development: Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports in Excel to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide stakeholders with actionable insights.   5.Data Mining: Utilize Excels data analysis tools (eg, Data Analysis ToolPak, Solver) to perform data mining and exploration, uncovering hidden patterns and relationships in the data.   6.Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and integrity by conducting thorough validation and reconciliation checks within Excel spreadsheets.   7.Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver timely analysis and reporting solutions using Excel.   8.Documentation: Document data analysis processes, methodologies, and assumptions in Excel workbooks to maintain transparency and facilitate knowledge sharing.   9.Continuous Learning: Stay updated on new Excel features, best practices, and tips/tricks to enhance data analysis capabilities and efficiency.     Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.     Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (eg, VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS), pivot tables, and charting tools.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into actionable insights using Excel.     Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.     Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.     Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.     Prior experience in a data analysis role using Excel is preferred.       Additional Skills (Preferred):       Familiarity with other data analysis and visualization tools (eg, Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.

column2: Position Description/ Requirements The Sr. BI Developer will be a part of the global team that designs, develops, and maintains BI solutions leveraging the modern BI tools and data engineering technologies for Koch Industries. Koch Industries is a privately held global organization with over 120,000 employees around the world, with subsidiaries involved in manufacturing, trading, and investments. Koch Technology Center (KTC) is being developed in India to extend its IT operations, as well as act as a hub for innovation in the IT function. As KGSI rapidly scales up its operations in India, its employees will get opportunities to carve out a career path for themselves within the organization. This role will have the opportunity to join on the ground and will play a critical part in helping build out the KGSI (Koch Global Services India) over the next several years. Working closely with global colleagues would provide significant global exposure to the employees. We are seeking a Sr. BI Developer who is self-motivated and can drive projects with minimal or no directions. The ideal candidate is someone who has the natural zeal to learn, experiment, innovate, believes in the art of possible, someone who is passionate about BI and keep himself up to date of how BI products and industry is evolving. The incumbent must be well versed with the entire BI development lifecycle, must have strong hands-on experience with SQL, data modelling, ETL, data visualization, BI performance troubleshooting and best practices and has worked with different features of Power BI and capabilities i.e. data flows, deployment pipelines, apps, Power BI REST APIs, XMLA endpoint etc. What You Will Need to Bring with You:  Designing, developing, new BI solutions and maintaining existing BI solutions. Should be able to develop and reengineer complex BI solutions.  Troubleshoot, enhance, and write complex SQL queries, stored procedures, CTEs. As part of the BI COE drive the effort and bring in ideas and strategies aiming to promote data literacy and self-service BI in the organization.  Should be a proponent of the art of possible by do, show, and share. Be very well versed with the features of Power BI and knows which feature is applicable for which use case. Setup BI best practices and standards for the organization. Strategize and provide recommendations to the leadership to modernize BI for the organization by proposing ideas, challenging status quo. Engage with businesses to help them in solutioning of BI. Transforming legacy BI solutions to modern self-service BI solution Providing technical guidance, training, and support to end-users. Provides training and support to the Power BI user community to drive BI adoption and create citizen developers. Review, experiment, and show existing and new features to the Power BI community. Work closely with different teams like O365, Power BI admin and Data gateway admins to ensure a holistically owned BI organization wide. 5-8 years of experience in Business Intelligence development. Demonstrated proficiency as a BI developer handling project from inception to the delivery and post-production support with stakeholder management. Strong understanding of BI lifecycle, data warehousing concepts, Data Modelling, and experience with writing complex SQL queries. Proficiency in writing DAX, M, optimizing data models and. Should know the suite of features in Power BI their use cases, advantages, disadvantages. Excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Outcome oriented and contribution motivated. Passion for developing self-service BI, data literacy and citizen developers. What Will Put You Ahead: (experience & education preferred) Other Considerations: (physical demands/ unusual working conditions) Experience in setting up, working in, or contributing to a BI or any other COE. Hands on experience with any other BI tool like Tableau/Qlik. Experience in Data engineering and cloud.Shift Timings: 12PM to 9 PM IST

column2: The role will work closely with the Data Governance, Master Data, Information Management, 3rd party service provider and Visualization CoE teams, as well as business stakeholders to ensure effective and consistent Data Quality Management.         The role will be hands-on, working to define and manage data quality through activities such as data profiling, data analysis, data quality rules definition and the ongoing management of data quality reports.         We are currently re-imagining our Data Quality journey to leverage the latest approaches and technologies so this is an opportunity to be part of a really exciting journey.         Key Responsibilities           Perform data profiling activities and analyse outcomes to share with identified stakeholders         Suggest and create data quality rules to be agreed with business stakeholders, usually Data Owners or Data Stewards.         Manage Data Quality reports in production/BAU, working with 3rd party service provider as required to oversee delivery, resolve issues with reports and associated DQ rules along with the implementation of small changes.         Contribute to the Information Catalogue from a DQ perspective to ensure that all DQ rules are correctly recorded and up to date.         Manage 3rd Party Service Provider resources to produce and maintain Data Quality reports.         Support the Data Quality Management Lead to realise the DQ framework, communicating out to involved parties on best practice and knowledge sharing.             Essential       Qualifications and skills           7+ years of previous experience of data quality management in a large organization, being familiar with working within a data quality framework to perform activities such as data profiling, data analysis, data quality rule definition and data quality reporting.         Able to analyse data profiling outputs to define/suggest DQ rules. It will also need to oversee resolution of any issues with data quality reports in BAU, working closely with 3rd party service provider.         Able to work with business stakeholders, with support from more senior team members as required.         Previous experience of overseeing DQ reporting operations to resolve issues and make small changes.         Able to communicate effectively with non-technical users.             Preferred             Knowledge of PowerBI and SQL would be considered beneficial.             Experience of working with Data Quality tools,         Ataccama experience (preferred).              Experience working with Microsoft Azure, Databricks.             Experience of working with 3rd party service providers.

Recognizes data trends and understands policy implementation. Participate in and drive continuous improvement in processes, guidelines, procedures, policy, and tooling. Develops advanced understanding of guidelines and identifies gaps and when they should be used. Go through content, extract information, find patterns in how the models are behaving. Analyze findings, develop, test, and communicate recommendations.     Use your linguistic and/or humanities expertise test impact of recommendations of policy and/or filtering changes. Use in house tools to transcribe and annotate data for various projects. A few examples may be providing transcription (text) for audio clips or annotating text or images to verify certain types of data.     Go through content (online and offline), extract information, provide needed information through tools with high accuracy and consistency.         Data Annotation Specialists are comfortable understanding data as it relates to :         Sentiment: The emotional intonation and other subjective implications behind keywords and phrases.     Intent: The human intent, or the user s end goal, behind different statements. Semantic: Understanding exactly what the meaning is behind what users are seeking.     Use deductive reasoning based on information provided in contextual turns to ensure data labelling is of the highest quality.     The role will be complete onsite

column1: Technical Assistant To CTO (on Third Party Payroll)
column2: Job Description for Technical Assistant to CTO (on Third Party Payroll) Responsibilities Communicating with stakeholders on technical subjects: needs to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders technical issues by composing clear, concise, and grammatically correct communications, using the appropriate tone and format. They also need to respond to any incoming technical queries / susggestions in a timely manner, and follow up on any pending technical issues or requests. Technical documentation: responsible for creating presentations, excel sheets, graphs and pictorial representations, maintaining the technical documentation e.g. BRDs, SRS, HLD, LLD, architecture documents, design documents, etc in an organized and accessible way. They need to keep an organised record of the necessary documents, in JIRA or Masterkraft or any other tool such as DMS/Teams/AWS repository or Github. They also need to retrieve any documents when requested. Conducting industry-specific research and creating supporting documents: A technical assistant needs to conduct research on industry-specific tech-centric topics and issues, to provide information and insights to the manager or the team. They need to use reliable sources and methods, such as online databases, journals, books, etc., to gather and analyze the data and information. They also need to create supporting charts, powerpoint slides, graphs, tables, etc., to present and summarize the research findings. Technical dashboards and reports for the CTO : A technical assistant needs to assist with creating and updating reports on various aspects of the technical business, such as GMV, orders, operations, performance, etc. They need to type up the reports using the relevant software and data, and ensure that they are accurate, complete, and consistent. Taking notes and minutes of the meetings on technical issues with TCS/BCG and other stakeholders: to attend meetings along with the manager both internally and externally and take down summary of minutes and decision points. They need to follow up on the minutes for closing the actions on the points.  Professional Qualifications Minimum 5 years as assistant / EA to senior officers in private or Government. Educational Qualifications Essential Any diploma / degree from recognised university / college. Fluency in English language (should have had English as a subject till at least till 12th class) Skilled in MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, MySQL Non-essential Any technical experience or skill, for example : coding language skill in C/C#/C++, Visual Basic, etc. Other preferred skills Researching papers, articles, journals, etc.

column2: Senior Adobe Target Developer   Experience - 2 - 4 yrs Role:  The Senior Adobe Target Developer is tasked with deploying, managing, and optimizing Adobe Target to enhance all product brand experiences across the organization. This role requires a high level of technical expertise in Adobe Target, Adobe Launch and Adobe Analytics, along with experience in crafting personalized, data-driven campaigns and solutions. Responsibilities:   Strategy: Craft a vision for personalization and testing strategies that align with organizational goals and maximize the potential of Adobe Target. Evaluate current digital marketing strategies and identify opportunities for enhancement through Adobe Targets capabilities. Work alongside the marketing team to integrate personalization strategies into broader campaigns, ensuring a consistent and engaging brand message. Operational: Build and manage a robust Adobe Target environment, ensuring stability, scalability, and responsiveness to the evolving needs of the business. Create and oversee the creation and implementation of detailed personalization and optimization plans across various digital assets. Ensure seamless integration of Adobe Target with other systems, such as CMS, CRM, and eCommerce platforms, for a unified marketing approach. Execute complex Adobe Target activities, including audience segmentation, targeting, and trigger-based personalization tactics. Problem Solving:   Conduct detailed analyses of campaign performances, using Adobe Targets testing results to inform and refine marketing strategies. Regularly audit and optimize Adobe Target implementations for enhanced performance and better user experiences. Create and maintain a knowledge base of best practices and lessons learned from past campaigns and technical challenges. Communication: Serve as the technical Adobe Target expert within cross-functional teams, offering guidance and insight into the capabilities and advantages of the platform. Translate technical concepts and campaign results into actionable insights for marketing teams and senior management. Lead training sessions for the marketing and development teams on Adobe Target features, updates, and best practices. Desired Experience: Minimum of 4 years of experience with a strong emphasis on Adobe Target development in a high-traffic, enterprise-level environment. Demonstrated expertise in successfully deploying Adobe Target to power complex product brand experiences, having worked with diverse teams and stakeholders. Proven ability in configuring, administering, and operating Adobe Target to create and execute multi-channel campaigns, including web, email, and mobile. Comprehensive experience in debugging, troubleshooting, and resolving Adobe Target configuration and integration issues in real-time, minimizing disruption to live environments. Experience partnering with analytics teams to align Adobe Target data with broader analytics initiatives, ensuring consistency and accuracy in measurement across customized site experiences. Proven track record of diagnosing and troubleshooting technical issues related to custom site experiences and achieving resolution that aligns with business objectives. Familiarity with conducting rigorous A/B and multivariate testing, understanding the nuances of testing methodologies, and interpreting results to guide marketing decisions. A history of working closely with design and UX teams to implement personalized user experiences based on data-driven insights. Involvement in the full project lifecycle, from conception through to development, deployment, and post-launch optimization and analysis. Prior experience in mentoring junior developers and leading by example in both technical expertise and project management. Demonstrated ability to write clear, maintainable code and documentation for Adobe Target implementations and to communicate complex technical issues to non-technical stakeholders. Desired Qualifications: Advanced degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Marketing, or Data Analytics. Certification in Adobe Target, Adobe Launch, and Adobe Analytics, with a deep understanding of the technical and strategic aspects of both tools. Extensive knowledge of web analytics, data analysis, and the interplay between data-driven decision-making and user experience design. Technical proficiency in database technology, including SQL-based databases like Redshift and Snowflake, and advanced reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SAS, Cision, Nielsen. Skilled in programming languages like Python, JavaScript, R, and SQL to support complex implementations and integrations.  Lead Developer   Experience - 4 - 6yrs Role:  The Adobe Target and Adobe Analytics Lead Developer is a technical expert role responsible for leading the development and implementation of Adobe Analytics and Adobe Target solutions. This role involves deep technical knowledge and the ability to architect, design, and customize Adobe solutions to fit business needs and objectives. The Lead Developer will ensure the robust and scalable deployment of Adobe's marketing tools to enhance data-driven decision-making and personalized user experiences. Responsibilities:   Strategy: Define the strategic direction for the development and integration of Adobe Target and Adobe Analytics within the organizations technical stack and marketing initiatives. Collaborate with the digital marketing and IT teams to enhance online consumer experiences through targeted content and data analytics. Spearhead the strategic employment of Adobe Target for content optimization, aligning with user behavior insights derived from Adobe Analytics. Devise and refine analytics-driven strategies to personalize user experience and improve key performance indicators. Operational: Lead the end-to-end development and implementation process for Adobe Target and Analytics initiatives, ensuring a seamless project lifecycle from conception to execution. Execute high-quality A/B testing, leveraging Adobe Target and Analytics to inform and validate content optimization strategies. Utilize deep expertise in database technologies (like Redshift and Snowflake) to structure data analysis that complements Adobe Target and Analytics initiatives. Apply advanced reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, SAS, Cision, Nielsen) to visualize test results and inform business decisions. Develop custom scripts and leverage programming languages (Python, JavaScript, R, SQL) to extend the functionality of Adobe Target and Analytics. column2: As a Customer Success Insights Analyst, you are responsible for providing analytical expertise to support key strategic and operational initiatives for our Customer Success Organization.                                                      Analysts use a range of statistical methods, algorithms, and analysis techniques to advise business leaders on strategy and identify opportunities to optimize business processes, customer experiences, and offerings. You will work closely with business stakeholders to distill your analysis into actionable insights and recommendations.                                                     You will join Commercial Customer Success team.                                                      You will report to Manager, Strategic Planning/Analytics.In Commercial Customer Success, we drive growth through irresistible customer experiences.                                                      For us, growth is two things: A focus on increasing retention and renewals rates and identifying opportunities for expansion to pass to our sales partners.                                                      With Resellers, we are accelerating customer retention performance and revenue growth by developing and maturing their Customer Success and Services practices. As part of the team, you will work on programs that impact Commercial Customer Success overall, and the specific functional area that you support.                                     Roles & Responsibilities           Serve as an analytics business partner - supporting business stakeholders with in-depth analysis, continually mining for insights to drive operational improvements         Conduct research from problem definition through execution of analysis. Highlight potential areas of concern for senior management based on your analysis         Assess impact of business strategies and provide clear articulation of analysis to support decision-making for senior management         Build sophisticated qualitative and quantitative analyses, including advanced modelling, that translate raw data into insights that can be turned into relevant recommendations and built into reports and dashboards         Be the data subject matter expert for the area of the business you support - understanding dataset structure, data quality, and appropriate analysis use cases         Understand existing data models and identify and document areas for improvement to contribute to the overall Autodesk data infrastructure               Minimum Qualifications           3-5 years Relevant Work Experience in the data analytics field         Experience in a similar role or a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or related field         Proficiency in writing and optimising SQL queries and working with large datasets         Working knowledge with visualisation tools (PowerBI, Qlikview, etc         Have experience working with a modern data warehouse ( Snowflake)         Microsoft Power BI Certification         Experience supporting Customer Success or Renewals organisations               The Ideal Candidate           you're a true data expert - you can creatively mine multiple different datasets to gain insights and answer business questions         You are curious - curiosity fuels your use of problem solving and analytical         You want to understand customer success - you're not just satisfied with building a cool model, you also want to make sure its relevant in the field         You tell compelling stories using data - you weave together a narrative based on your analysis of what is happening in the business, why it is happening and why it matters and can present your findings to both experts and general audiences         You are a partner - you are communicative and empathic with stakeholders and business leaders to determine how to best answer their questions through analysis

column2: The ability to collect, analyze and interpret scientific/business information relevant to the identification of early investment/partnering opportunities is critical to inform the Lilly Venture Science teams strategy      The LRL Venture Science Consultant provides analysis and insight on a variety of technologies, scientific concepts, companies, and assets that are of interest to our overall ventures and business development organization      The core of the Venture Science Consultant role is to be a trusted and valued business partner who has deep technical information and data expertise along with a strong analytical skill set      The Venture Science consultant will partner with the venture science and business intelligence teams to provide expertise in intelligence research and analysis that informs Lillybroader investment strategy                    Responsibilities:            Collaborate with the venture science teams to identify areas of specific interest to build landscapes and other evergreen reporting mechanisms that inform strategic decisions.      Identify relevant and reliable sources of data/information or surrogate information sources and assimilate it quickly into useful formats to inform broader venture strategy.      Apply analytical and creative problem-solving skills to bring data from multiple sources together and contextualize for research/business meaning. Projects may include, but are not limited to, landscapes (target, disease, clinical, or technology), pipeline analyses, company profiles, general surveillance.      Identify and suggest alternative paths of inquiry for challenging questions. An inquisitive mindset and a passion for investigating hard-to-find information when addressing questions with ambiguity and uncertainty is necessary.      Be able to provide and defend gathered intelligence, methodology, content, and conclusions to leadership in a clear, concise format.      Work collaboratively within the Business Development Intelligence team to prioritize work and deliver on time-sensitive requests.Including collecting and managing internal data as well as authoring on internal reports for senior leadership.                Basic Qualifications/Requirements:            Advanced degree/PhD in life sciences domain, scientific, or health-related field (Pharma/Biotech).      5-10 years of experience in scientific or pharmaceutical intelligence roles.      Excellent organizational skills; able to manage multiple projects and juggle conflicting priorities in an ambiguous environment.          Demonstrated high learning agility; able to quickly grasp new concepts and absorb large amounts of information under pressure.      Ability to simplify complex information and concepts in a clear, concise and digestible format so the reader can quickly understand the content and conclusions of the analysis.      Excellent communications skills in the form of oral presentation as well as other mediums (Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint).                Additional Skills/Preferences:            MBA or equivalent business development experience with focus on business development activities.      Relevant scientific or intelligence experience in one or more research areas of interest for Lilly (genetic medicines, digital health, devices, connected care, diabetes, oncology, immunology, neurodegeneration, pain, discovery chemistry).      Experience with artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing, or designing user interfaces.                Soft Skills:            Strong work ethic, personal motivation, and team player who is dynamic and result oriented.      Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones (true global team base).      Strong desire to build and own their personal brand as the interact across a dynamic team.
