column2: Skill required:  Reporting & Insights - Reporting Analytics Designation:  Specialist Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 7 to 11 Years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? The Advanced Analytics CoE team uses applied intelligence and other advanced data analytics for informed decision-making for leadership and solve specific business problems to run business operations efficiently. It is a part of Reporting and Insights within FE Business Operations, Accenture Operations and is looking to enhance engagement with the business leadership. We are looking for an Analytics and Modeling Specialist who will support our operations teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have experience in extracting data from large sets, analyzing and visualizing the data using Power BI or other data visualization techniques. column2: Job Description: Job Title: Client Marketing Analytics M+C Sales Career Level: L9 Location: India The Accenture Marketing + Communications Data & Analytics team delivers high value insights and analytics capabilities that empowers Marketing + Communications to be data-driven, deliver relevant experiences, and efficiently operate and optimize for ROI. This role is responsible for executing analysis to generate actionable client insights for our client marketing team focused on supporting high value deals and pursuits. This includes developing account and pursuit insights to inform marketing strategy, analyzing and synthesizing insights to enable marketers to optimize for marketing effectiveness, educating teams on measurement strategy and reporting tools and identifying opportunities to enhance our capabilities to meet evolving needs.  Job Specifications / Responsibilities Leverage quantitative and qualitative analysis, and data mining to analyze and optimize the client journey and experience, measure tactic performance for pursuit based opportunities. Connect digital, cross-channel analytics with CRM insights to deliver closed loop reporting including client opportunities and revenue impact Leverage quantitative and qualitative analysis to analyze pursuits and develop insights regarding reasons for win/loss such as deal attributes, competitive insights and more Educate marketers to leverage automated dashboards and analytics solutions to enable self-serve analytics insights and recommendations. Leverage feedback to identify opportunities to enhance analytics capabilities to meet evolving stakeholder needs Manage ad-hoc reporting requests including prioritization and delivery of reports and insights to meet stakeholders needs Perform UAT on data & analytics solutions as needed Adhere to and evangelize data privacy and security compliance policies and proceduresExperience & QualificationsEducation:  Bachelor's degree required, Master's degree a plusWork Experience: 5+ years analytics experience; B2B marketing analytics a plusOther Requirements Excellent communication, presentation, and critical thinking skills Proven ability to successfully collaborate within and across a variety of teams Rigorously detail-oriented with commitment to accuracy and track record of project management success Ability to influence leadership and stakeholders through relationship-building, executive-level presence and subject matter expertise Ability to prioritize projects with a focus on impact Ability to operate with a high level of energy, commitment and enthusiasm to take on a complex, challenging role in a dynamic, fast-paced organization Qualification Qualifications Solid understanding of marketing measurement tools and metrics including web, CRM, social media, email and client intent. Specific experience Salesforce is preferred. Specific experience with Adobe Analytics, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn insights, a plus. Experience with generating quantitative analysis leveraging Excel, data visualization (PowerBI) or other tools.  Ability to query/mine large data sets, knowledge of SQL, BigQuery, Python preferred Demonstrable skills in consulting and partnering with marketing stakeholders to uncover business questions and deliver relevant analytics and insights to meet their needs Strong analytical mindset and skills, including the ability to break down complex data scenarios into easily digestible reports and deliverables. Plus, the initiative to go beyond the what and deliver insights into the "why" of various results English language proficiency

They are looked upon as the specialists in charge of interacting with business stake holders, gathering requirements and creating effective Business Intelligence (BI) solutions and analytics dashboards. Experience developing reports and dashboard with - Microsoft Power BI. Working experience in commercial & regulatory reporting- Experience with connecting multiple data sources in Power BI to implement working reports- Advanced SQL writing skills, strong understanding of relational and dimensional data models - Extensive knowledge in various reporting objects and it include Facts, Attributes, Hierarchies and Transformations. Candidate should be able to respond to technical queries / requests from team members and customers. Also, should be able to coach, guide and mentor junior members in the team. What are we looking for? Educational Qualification:Bachelor's degree in engineering or science or equivalent graduates with minimum 4 years of experience.Skills:Must-have: 1+ years of experience for the desired candidate who need to be excellent in writing DAX in MS Power BI Desktop. Need to have experience in creating calculated measures and columns with DAX in MS Power BI Desktop. Strong domain knowledge in Retail Industry domain. Team management and project management Excellent communication and inter-personal skills, accustomed to work in a team environment with tight schedules and capable of working efficiently under pressure. Do POCs to showcase the capabilities of Microsoft Power BI to customerGood to have: Very strong SQL skills in at least one DB technology i.e. Teradata or any other database like Oracle, UDB. Teradata skills are preferred. Understanding of ETL process- Good database knowledge and experience, should be able to write complex SQL queries Knowledge on Power BI Mobile is a plus. Knowledge on Azure is an added advantage.  Roles and Responsibilities: Minimum overall 5-6 years of experience in leading Analytics projects for large Retail clients Experience in creating dashboards, volume reports, operating summaries, and presentations and graphs. SSRS Integration to Power BI. Experience in Data Gateway for data refreshing, content Pack Library. Expert in publishing reports to app.powerbi.com and setting up the necessary connection details and scheduling. Excellent knowledge connecting Microsoft Power BI Desktop to various data sources. SQL Server is desirable. Experience in Custom Visuals and Groups Creation. Experience in Managing Embed Codes Proficient at data visualization using Power BI and a strong application development. Implementation of Row Level Security by defining various constraints for each defined ROLE. Must have a background in data analysis, insight generation etc. 3+ years of experience on SQL Server 2012 or advanced versions. SQL Server 2016 is an added advantage. Good SQL knowledge and code optimization skills to improve performance of the reports for faster performance.  Expert knowledge using advanced calculations using MS Power BI Desktop (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table). Good at creating different visualizations using Slicers, Lines, Pies, Histograms, Maps, Scatter, Bullets, Heat Maps, Tree maps, etc. Analyze business requirements and work with client areas to produce functional specifications for use as reference in creation of the reporting and analytical solutions. Provides accurate level of effort estimates and delivery plans for projects and initiatives. Ability to showcase complete dashboard implementations that demonstrate visual best practices e g color themes visualization layout interactivity drill down capabilities filtering etc Experience with the preparation of data for visualization e g data profiling data cleansing volume assessment and partitioning modeling data etc Experience in gathering and translating end user requirements into effective efficient dashboards Experience working with relational data sources like Oracle SQL Server and flat files Good experience with cloud based data sources e g Salesforce, Google, Azure.

column2: UKG is looking for a self-driven, process minded Business Systems Internal Control Analyst with an enterprise lens to join our GDS Business System Solutions team. As a Business Applications Analyst on the GDS Business Systems Solutions team, you will help develop and execute a critical, comprehensive internal control system that is aligned to UKG goals, KPIs and will support quality E2E systems and processes for our effective scaling and growth. In addition to supporting the framework and implementation of the End-to-End internal controls system, you will be responsible for supporting a proactive auditing function to identify process and workflow inconsistencies that could lead to a loss of data integrity, revenue leakage, inaccurate delivery tool provisioning and customer credits. Leveraging your enterprise-wide internal audit function, you will assess the current state, identify gaps, and recommend end user process and system workflow changes to align to Internal control efficiency and OKRs. With the significant layer of cross functional reliance upon effective system workflows and data quality, you will partner with the GDS BSS System owners and Cross functional business leaders and reporting SMEs. This cross functional collaboration will ensure that we understand how GDS BSS system data is used to enable us to drive system and process governance and changes that will have a positive outcome. With successful GDS Business System Solutions Internal Controls, we will: Leveraging data driven business decisions to drive the UKG1 harmonization roadmap, consolidating and/or removing disparate legacy systems and processes creating a unified, efficient operational UKG. Optimize the efficiency of business processes and standard operating procedures through proactive monitoring, solutioning and change management, resulting in faster throughput without compromising quality across the GDS Business System Solutions: Salesforce, PSA and Project Management tool provisioning.  Qualifications BA or BS degree or equivalent practical experience  Minimum 2-3 years of business process and data analytics  Power BI and Excel skills with knowledge of data transformation and data modeling. Highly skilled in using power query and high proficiency with DAX and M coding languages required.  Proficiency in building complex reports across Open Air, Salesforce, and IBM Cognos preferred. Analytical mindset for evaluating data and identifying trends, patterns, anomalies, and outliers. Analytical and problem-solving skills to include ability understand databases, data structures to facilitate auditing and reporting.  Strong desire to identify data gaps and creative thinking in pattern analysis and data forensics to identify audit gaps and root cause.  Strong attention to details, with ability to drill down into very tactical considerations to ensure accuracy in deliverables.  Self-starter and autonomous, ability to multi-task, work independently, prioritize and get things done.  Excellent customer service, stakeholder management, oral and written communication skills Strong background and understanding of SaaS business model preferred. Financial and business acumen preferred.
column11: Power BI, standard operating procedures, internal control, gds, customer service, data structures, dax, auditing, internal audit, finance

column2: Description We have a wide variety of career opportunities around the world ??come find yours.   Finance  The Finance department, which manages the company's budgets, forecasts and investments, and provides analysis of our financial performance and strategies.   Job overview and responsibilities  Provides data-driven and intelligent automation services and solutions that help super charge Internal Audit?? ability to go after risk and enhance every aspect of the function. This position will primarily work with Audit management & Project Leads to support ad-hoc data requests, develop and maintain advanced analytics through analytics tools and an analytics platform, and help increase the departments analytics IQ through training and collaborative work. This team member will leverage data to enable greater efficiency, expand audit coverage, and drive deeper analysis that translates into strategic actionable insights. They will help tell the data story with data triangulation and visualizations.   Core Data Analytics, Strategy and Program Support:    Executes on Data Analytics strategy developed by IA management within the context of audit responsibilities, such as risk assessment, audit planning, creation of reusable tools, and provides innovative solutions to complex problems.   Builds production-ready analytical tools and workflows to simplify and automate repeatable and reusable processes within IA.   Advances the analytics program and platform by creating and enhancing processes, templates, and tools that can be reused to mature and optimize capabilities   Helps train team members and promote the use of intermediate to advance analytics within the department Project Management and Execution:    Drives the innovative use of audit analytics through direct participation in all phases of audits (planning, fieldwork and reporting)   Demonstrates project management experience through using available tools and technology and escalate project management issues as needed   Is able to work through problem solving and solutioning independently and in an efficient manner, and solicits input from others strategically   Independently leads internal and external stakeholder meetings, understands business processes, designs analytical procedures, and identifies data-driven solutions that expand risk and testing coverage   Designs and supports digital dashboards that visualize audit results, findings, and strategic insights Prepares and presents to IA leadership and stakeholders project results, recommendations, insights, and conclusions supported by advanced analytics   Supports, plans, coordinates, conducts, and documents audits/reviews in accordance with Internal Audit and IPPF Standards Business Acumen and collaboration:   Partners with audit teams to help identify risks associated with businesses and facilitate strategic data sourcing and develops innovative solutions to increase efficiency and effectiveness of audit testing.   Collaborates withs teams to sense, evaluate, and embed data-driven risk management activities into the business operating rhythm.   Understands the internal control environment and develops data-supported recommendations to optimize risk through root-cause analysis   Builds and manages relationships and communications with Audit team members and the analytics community This position is offered on local terms and conditions. Expatriate assignments and sponsorship for employment visas, even on a time-limited visa status, will not be awarded.       Qualifications Required    Bachelor's degree   4+ years of experience with analytics   Expertise in Python, SQL, and visualization tools   Proficient in statistics, including descriptive statistics, data distribution models, Time Series Analysis, correlation, and regression   Experience with database querying using Teradata SQL and/or Microsoft SQL   Must be legally authorized to work in India for any employer without sponsorship   Must be fluent in English (written and spoken)   Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification   Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position Preferred   Master?? Degree   Experience in audit, risk management, finance, data analytics and technology functions   Experience with data preparation tools such as Monarch and Data Snipper preferred   Direct experience in the transportation/aviation fields and BIG4s   Prior financial and operational audit testing experience   Experience working with Palantir Foundry platform   Experience with analytical/ statistical programs such as SAS, SPSS, and R Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT Req. ID: GGN00001517

column2: Photon Infotech P Ltd  is looking for Power BI Lead  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Leadership and Team Management: Leading a team of Power BI developers, analysts, and data visualization experts      This involves providing guidance, assigning tasks, and ensuring the team's productivity and performance      Solution Architecture: Designing and architecting Power BI solutions aligned with business requirements      This includes understanding data sources, modeling data, and creating efficient data visualization solutions      Project Management: Overseeing the planning, execution, and delivery of Power BI projects      This involves setting project timelines, managing resources, and ensuring project milestones are achieved within budget and scope      Data Modeling and Transformation: Leading efforts in data modeling, data transformation, and creating data sets within Power BI to ensure accurate and meaningful data representation      Dashboard and Report Development: Overseeing the development of visually appealing and insightful dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using Power BI, ensuring they meet business user needs      Data Governance and Quality: Implementing data governance practices, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with data quality standards within Power BI solutions      Collaboration and Stakeholder Management: Collaborating with business stakeholders, understanding their requirements, and translating them into effective Power BI solutions      Managing stakeholder expectations and providing regular updates on project progress      Training and Knowledge Sharing: Conducting training sessions for team members and business users on Power BI best practices, features, and functionalities      Facilitating knowledge sharing within the team and the broader organization

column2: Risk Infrastructure is responsible for the overall governance and support of the firm s Financial Risk platform.                                              This includes activities like Input Data Management and Control, Exposure Metric Validation, Data Integrity & consistency, Counterparty Exposure validation and Capital Assurance, Risk Limit Management and Risk Reporting.                                                                                  In addition they assist Risk Managers (RM) in resolving data issues where necessary and take corrective actions. RI also drives data management strategy for Risk and helps develop data architectures that are flexible and scalable to meet new regulatory requirements.                                            MRI(Market Risk Infrastructure)                  is responsible for the integrity of the data which flows into the firms Market risk management systems and the controls which govern the sign off and reporting of risk metrics by Market Risk Managers.                                      MRI Role involves:                                  Ensures relationships between range of reference data, Trade attributes, instrument and transaction data are not broken. Whilst input data is validated; reported data is reconciled.                              Assist Risk Managers (RM) in overriding data where necessary as part of Adjustments/overrides                              MRI function reconciles reports between systems to ensure that numbers from multiple systems are consistent                              Drives data management strategy for Risk and helps develop data architectures                              Provide ad-hoc risk views and drill down analysis of less transparent risks and issues of                              Importance to senior Risk Management/Trading Heads                              The candidate must have a strong background in visual data delivery; interactive design and SQL with a passion for re imagine/ design.                              In addition, the candidate will be responsible for planning, designing, coordinating and developing highly interactive dashboards, reports with built-in guided analytics for various lines of business                            Qualification                        BE/B.Tech/ Masters/ MBA in Finance                        IT Qualification                        SQL, Python, Alteryx                                        Role & Responsibilities:                                        Manage a team of analysts supporting T+1 sign-off of Market Risk metrics                                  Experience in understanding & developing target operating models aligned with the Business.                                  Implement business processes and controls aligned with the Operating model.                                  Work closely with other divisions like Technology, Market Risk and Methodology to implement strategic and regulatory initiatives like FRTB IMA/SA, cloud migration etc.                                  Solid, deep experience with data extract, transform and load (ETL) tools as Alteryx and data visualization tools                                  Write Complex SQL queries on multiple tables using complex joins                                  Perform end to end Data validation                                  Ability to interact with business users and understand their requirements                                  Develop impactful presentations and documents                                  Communicate complex topics to team through both written and oral communications                                  Understand if there is technical or business limitation to implement control/configuration                                  Understand and document the compensating control for managing or mitigating security risk that might exist due to the technical or business limitation                                  Provide recommendations to strengthen current processes and controls                                                      Provide regular updates on assign tasks to team members                                    Domain                                  Strong knowledge Market Risk and risk measures like VaR, IRC,SVaR etc.                              Experience in handling complex projects/teams and building operating models                              Proficient in data structures and associated tools like SQl, VBA, Python etc.                              Proficiency in Business analysis / Project management                                  Strong Analytical skills.                              Excellent communication skills both Written / verbal must.                              Strong team player and quick learner.                              Work with various stake holders including business , IT, Change Management etc.

column2: As an Associate Competitive Intelligence & Strategy Analyst, you will work cross-functionally to support Anaplan s global strategy and competitive intelligence efforts          You will assist with in-depth competitor analysis, data gathering, and will be comfortable utilizing our Anaplan competitive model to uncover insights and trends within the data      Additionally, you will analyze large volumes of data to extract competitive and market insights, which will inform go-to-market (GTM) strategy and product decisions      You will also collaborate with GTM Strategy & Planning internal customers such as Marketing, Sales, Presales, and Product, assisting in data and competitor analysis to help build collateral that equips the field with Anaplan s value differentiators relative to competitors        You will possess excellent communication skills, seek to understand the perspectives of participants in meetings, speak up to drive conversations, and form strong relationships with our internal partners          This position is fully remote in India      Preference will be given to candidates located near Anaplan offices in the country          Gain a comprehensive understanding of Anaplan s product capabilities and the competitive landscape across Finance/Workforce, Sales, and Supply Chain planning        Partner with your peers and the Solutions & Industry Marketing team to develop battlecards and other competitive content and assets        Respond to ad-hoc questions and requests from the field regarding competitors and best practices in competitive selling        Perform competitive and market analysis and analyse internal competitive data to develop insights        Analyse existing data sets for opportunities to improve competitive insights and data collection, then drive updates as appropriate      Proactively publish competitive news and intelligence to internal collaboration tools        Manage the rationalization and cleanup of opportunity data from Salesforce to build a credible dataset that supports competitive win/loss metrics and various business functions        Analyse and review trends from modelling to advise on GTM sales plays, marketing campaigns, and product roadmap decisions        Collaborate with Customer Marketing to develop competitive win customer case studies        Develop, support, and present detailed presentations and conclusions for leadership and internal teams        Accommodate ad-hoc requests from the organization                    Your Qualifications:                          Bachelor s degree in a field that emphasizes analytical and communication skills, such as Business, Economics, or a related discipline.      2 years of experience in competitive intelligence, preferably within technology / SaaS, or connected planning / xP&A domains.          Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and experience with Salesforce as well as project management tools      Strong analytical skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects attentively and meet deadlines.              Experience working cross-functionally with an entrepreneurial and agile mindset in a dynamic and fast-paced environment preferred.          Proficiency in analytics, BI, and visualization tools like Tableau or similar with advanced skills in data analysis techniques such as statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and data mining.              Familiarity with market research methods in both primary (qualitative and quantitative) and secondary research; understanding of market segmentation and competitive positioning strategies.              Experience as a user or consultant for Anaplan or other connected planning / xP&A software.        Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion, and belonging.      Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.      Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible, and then followed up via written communication.

column2: The role is responsible for data analysis, quality assurance, quality scoring of data products and solutions for the organization including participating in design, architecture, and implementation of data, BI, and analytics solutions. Additionally, the role involves close coordination with the technology, product mgmt. and the business teams with a focus on the business user.             Job Requirements             Relevant Experience       6+ years overall experience     3+ years of experience in Data Warehousing & BI leading business requirements analysis, customer engagement, development and/or data analysis. Data Architecture experience would be preferred.     Technical Know-how/Tools used     Perform Quality assurance for enterprise data analytics products and solution.     Develop and implement data quality standards, policies, and procedures to ensure consistent and reliable data across systems.     Conduct thorough data quality assessments and analysis to identify inconsistencies, inaccuracies, and anomalies in datasets.     Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to define data quality requirements and standards for new and existing datasets.     Design and execute data quality tests and validation processes to assess the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data.     Develop data quality metrics and scoring methodologies to measure and monitor data quality performance.     Generate data quality reports and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.     Investigate root causes of data quality issues and collaborate with relevant teams to implement corrective actions.     Experience with BI tools (Hyperion, PowerBI, Looker) is preferred.     Expertise in SQL stored procedures and conducting performance tuning/optimization is preferred.     Snowflake certified professionals are preferred.     Certified professionals in Agile, Product, Project Management are preferred.       Behavioural Skills       Ability to work in ambiguous situations by virtue of organizational knowledge, insights, past experience and support teams to adapt their ways of working.     Ability to create appropriate framework for creative thinking and drive agile mindset and flexible ways of working for teams.     Ability to ensure inclusiveness in ways of working with the team, acknowledging, and uncovering unconscious biases, creating a trusting workplace.     Ability to drive strategy and adapt to new information and industry changes and shift team priorities when needed.     Ability to demonstrate strong knowledge of business strategies, metrics and trends impacting the achievement of business and enterprise goals in decision making.     Ability to map explicit, implicit and unstated needs of both existing & potential stakeholders leading to tailored delivery, continued relevance and higher satisfaction along with building trust and long-term relationship with stakeholders.     Ability to seek and provide feedback on performance and behaviour, using it for self-awareness, development and shared learning.     Ability to champion systems for shared learning, knowledge management and preservation, and suggests ways to incorporate learning across teams and engage in continuous learning.     Ability to set and act to reach challenging goals for self and others, with tactful prioritization and planning to attain goals and achieve exceptional performance and results.     Ability to make systematic effort to seamlessly obtain needed data or feedback for logical and data-driven solutioning and uses lateral thinking to solve problems.     Ability to encourage co-creation and leverage connections made to deliver results and respect conflicting opinions.     Ability to foster contextualized two-way communication with diverse audiences using the appropriate mode (verbal/written), channels and communication formats to drive strategic objectives, foster active listening                       Roles & Responsibilities           Operational Excellence       1. Manage the end-to-end execution of data quality assessment, monitoring and QA in collaboration with business and technology teams!     2. Perform required data analysis for the data/product solutions in the pipeline across the organization.     3. Provide structure to ambiguous environments and resolve problems through technical & functional-based solutions as applicable.         Stakeholder Management       1. Interact with the business users & technology team on a frequent basis to understand their quality requirements.     2. Keep abreast of the outstanding issues by regularly communicating with business users/technology team to update on the pending backlogs, identify the bottlenecks, and address them for a speedy resolution.     3. Understand complex technical concepts & insights and communicate the same to non-technical stakeholders.     4. Collaborate closely with the business, engineering, production to ensure delivery success

column2: Role To help in building the detailed process maps, following the BPMN mapping standards, based on defined timelines. Review the controls in processes and identify process gaps across the EQ Group. This role will be critical in process standardization and re-engineering. Work with the Risk team on Organization Risk and Control Management. The role to be based out of Chennai location. Business Function Process CoE team work closely with the EQ India Operation and EQ Group functions across UK and US in driving the initiatives to optimize end-to-end processes across the organization. Estabilishing a culture of continuous improvement and helping the organization to manage the operations efficiently through robust control frameworks and process standardization. Core Duties and Responsibilities Understand and create standardized process flows using BPMN standards. Identify opportunities to optimize end-to-end processes across the organization as per BPMN standards. Work closely with the operations and transition team, to understand the migrating processes. Review the process to identify potential gaps while coming up with process flows. Ensure that control measures are effectively integrated into daily process flows. While mapping the processes, look for the effectiveness of controls, make recommendations for improvements as needed. Perform trend analysis to anticipate potential challenges and implement preventive measures to mitigate. Support the operations and risk teams in implementing robust control frameworks to mitigate identified risks. Periodically review with Operations to update the revised processes and controls that the processes have underwent. Take lead in implementing continuous improvement intiatives, proactively identify opportunities for enhancement. Ensure the implementation of reviewed and revised processes and controls by the respective stakeholders. Competencies and Experience The candidate should posses the following experience, skills and behaviours: Bachelors degree in Business administration, Finance, Information Technology, or a relevant field. 2 to 5 years of experience with minimum 1 to 3 years as a Business Process Analyst or in a similar role. Hands on experience in using business process mapping tools is required (e.g., IBM Blueworks, Aris, Igraffx). Understanding of business process management and notation (BPMN) methodologies and tools. Proficiency in process modeling and analysis techniques is a plus (e.g., BPMN, Six Sigma, Lean). In-depth knowledge about work/process standardization, risk identification and controls is a plus. Understanding of process automation, workflow management, or business process management systems is preferred.

This team provides workforce related reporting, analytics, and business insights to HR professionals and business leaders across multiple locations. Team members couple their technical capability with functional expertise to bridge the gap between business problems and data driven solutions. The HR Analytics & Automation team supports the design, development, deployment, and maintenance of all custom reporting, dashboards, and analytical insights for the HR function. The HR Analytics Data Analyst will help lead the way in transforming HR into a truly data-driven organization through applying innovative approaches to optimize and further support our data extraction, manipulation, and security. We are seeking an individual who is excited about helping our leaders look around corners with data-driven recommendations for innovative programs that improve performance, retention, and improve the overall employee experience. Utilizes SuccessFactors, People Analytics, Tableau and other tools for data for analysis and ensures data gets populated in the right manner and with the right cadence, frequency and quality. Frequently works with messy or incomplete data and makes decisions on how that data will be processed and maintained. Provide data consultation related to new or existing integration development. Partner closely with HRIS and IT to build the required reports to collect, analyze and present data. Builds a foundation of analytical capabilities throughout the HR organization and trains others in advanced analytic methods, as needed. Recommend business process or system enhancements to improve reporting capabilities and influence system owners to incorporate changes. Outline and lead HR and other function team members in data literacy, quality assurance and data management principals. column2: About the Role:           Grade Level (for internal use):     09         The Team:    With IPCA products in the market since 1963, this team has a focus on refining and petrochemical industries from a financial analytics and process technology perspective.           The Impact:    Our core strength is providing our customers a transparent and independent view of such process technology and economic/financial competitive analytics against a business sustainability (commercial and financial framework, using a "bottom-up" chemical engineering and financial approach. This position will play an important role in maintaining and developing downstream and chemical competitor databases which utilize detailed proprietary financial and operational models as well as writing financial reports based on output from these models.           What s in it for you:    IPCA, is global in coverage and is powered by our team of well experienced Chemical Engineers, Chemists, CFAs and MBAs to evaluate embryonic, developing, commercially operating chemical, refinery, decarbonization, renewables, bio, and energy-related process technologies, and their potential impact on company and industry real-time and long-term financial performance.              What We re Looking For     :         Bachelor s degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, econometrics, or industry-related fields (Energy or Chemicals) required; graduate degree is a plus.             Minimum of 2-3 years directly related experience in data analytics, databases, data transformation, information sciences, statistical analysis or similar.         Experience in working on cloud-based environment (like AWS/Databricks) for model development and deployment             Proficiency in MS Excel/VBA and Power BI with a good knowledge SQL Python.             Strong analytical and problem-solving skills along with strong listening, verbal, and written communication skills including a mastery of the English language.         Ability to prioritize tasks and work independently with minimal supervision.         Highly focused on project delivery.             General understanding and interest in energy chemical markets.                 Responsibilities and Impact:             Responsible for publication of data tables and dashboards for CSP Refining Chemical deliverables.         Improve and develop company financial models utilizing results from our asset level-based refinery and chemical models, RCMA CCMA, respectively.         Assist with making improvements to the newly developed RAPID (Refinery Petrochemical Integrator Decarbonizer) tool developing automation to add new technologies and to connect refinery output data         Assist with refinery chemical pricing databases to streamline the update processes         Design, build, and deliver custom dashboards and reports through MS Excel/VBA and/or Power BI.         Work with research team to support database consolidation and data verification required for research/consulting deliverables.         Work with subject matter experts to determine and address data needs and develop research products as needed.                     Benefits:         We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That s why we provide everything you and your career need to thrive at SP Global.     Our benefits include:          Health Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.         Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.         Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.         Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.         Family Friendly Perks: It s not just about you. SP Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families. column2: Consultants combine best-in-class analytic skills with strong problem-solving and communication abilities to help clients solve strategic and tactical business problems. Consultants are skilled at all aspects of project execution with the ability to prepare client-ready materials with limited oversight / guidance from project managers. They are expected to independently manage specific tasks / workstreams within projects and mentor junior team members. Consultants may work on multiple projects simultaneously and lead a small team in each one of them.             Position Responsibilities               Ensures development of a successful project / workstream plan after high level direction from the senior project lead with a clear understanding of project objectives         Takes ownership of methodology instrument design for market research projects to address key objectives based on high level guidance provided by senior project team member.          Translates understanding of brand strategy and client needs & beliefs into likely hypotheses, and ensures analytical approach is effective in testing hypotheses to find most relevant insights.          Anticipates potential challenges in analysis and proactively works with team to figure out a mitigation strategy.          Demonstrates creative flexibility and innovation to modify design approach as necessary with more abstract client feedback or changing business project objectives.          Is able to use the prior experience to apply advanced statistical knowledge (CHAID, Choice modeling, Clustering, kNN, Regression etc.) to solve a business problem.         Ensures that team members are able to execute the analysis with right analytical approach and proper quality check guidelines.         Proactively creates good processes and automation set ups to increase the efficiency and quality of the deliverables          Responsible for quality of entire team and all materials; double-checks all project materials and analysis provided from other team members.          Maintains focus on strategic implications of analytical insights, and effectively guides junior team member(s) to achieve necessary depth and breadth of insights.         Ensure client needs and preferences are incorporated into slide development; customizes report to audience and format of presentation when developing deliverables.          Guides development of new slide frameworks and visual templates that can present key data / insights powerfully.         Sends timely and thoughtful responses to client/leadership requests, questions, and needs.         Presents project findings & recommendations to clients in a compelling and engaging way (when appropriate based on client presentation preferences)          Responsible for professional development, engagement and coaching of junior team members.          Teaches best practices to junior team members for structured written and verbal communication.          Demonstrates a desire and willingness to learn and learns for all interactions and team members on a project/team Adapts working style as needed, developing strong collaboration and trust across team members.         Demonstrates good judgement across all interactions, and a respect for all team members internally and externally.              Position Requirements               Education     :         A bachelor s or master s degree in a quantitative, analytical discipline, such as Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Management Science, Data Science, Statistics, or Engineering will be preferred.              Consultants    Minimum 3 years of experience in Market Research and marketing consulting work. Knowledge of US healthcare market will be a plus.          Experience in execution of advanced analytical methods CHAID, Hypothesis Testing, A/B testing, CART, Regression, Clustering, Factor Analysis, MNL, Choice Modeling, kNN, K-means, Predictive analysis, Generalized Linear Models etc.          Knowledge of tools/programming platforms Sawtooth, R, SAS, SPSS, Advanced Excel, Advanced Powerpoint          Experience in writing surveys and discussion guides with knowledge of biases and ways to make instruments easier for respondents.          Evidence of leading and managing teams/projects          Evidence of strong oral and written communication          Evidence of working in a fast-paced versatile environment         Comfort and flexibility with ambiguity          Strong attention to detail with a quality focused mindset          Evidence for high motivation and good professional attitude/work ethic.            A bachelor s or master s degree in a quantitative, analytical discipline, such as Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Management Science, Data Science, Statistics, or Engineering will be preferred.

column2: Senior   Test   Analyst   (Data   &   Analytics) Coeo are trusted data management and analytics experts, delivering technology strategy and support for business. The team have deep technical and commercial experience working with Microsoft Data Services to help our clients optimise their costs and maximise the benefits from their investments in these technologies. Coeo has been established for over 15 years and has offices in Reading, UK and Hyderabad, India. We are exclusively focused on Microsoft technologies. Our mission is to help our clients predict their future through the better use of data, technology, people, and processes. To do this our business has always focused on: ??Data Managed Services ??Data Platform Consultancy ??Analytics Consultancy ??Artificial Intelligence Consultancy ??Adoption and Change Management We are looking for an experienced Senior Test Analyst, who brings a proven background in data and analytics to work with technical and business stakeholders to communicate, design and implement test strategies to ensure data solutions are delivered reliably and to the highest quality. Your expertise in data testing and analytical skills will contribute to the success of our projects. Key   Responsibilities: To be successful in the role you will be expected to: ??Be hands on in the creation of test cases and test execution. ??Oversee junior members of the team ensuring their deliverables are in line with  best practice, standards and aligned to requirements. ??Be a strong advocate for test automation with extensive experience in delivering working solutions. ??Create manual and automated test cases to verify functional and non-functional  requirements of solutions in various stages of the development life cycle. ??Find critical bugs and verify reported issues; identifying their underlying cause  and seeing them through to resolution and liaising with other teams where  appropriate. ??Producing descriptive and concise bug reports that evidence the functionality of a solution. ??Communicating status information and issues to a variety of stakeholders, adapting appropriately depending on the audience Knowledge   and   experience   required: ??Senior level experience in testing data solutions, covering Data Warehouses, ETL/ELT processes and dimensional modelling concepts. ??Ability to create, adapt and execute effective test strategies. ??Ability to think creatively, problem solve and innovate. ??Extensive experience in database and BI technologies.   Senior   Test   Analyst   (Data   &   Analytics) ??Experience in testing data and storage services in Azure (Azure SQL Database, Data Lake and data storage). ??Extensive experience in testing BI reports, dashboards, datasets and data models. ??Experience in agile software development methodologies including BDD & TDD. ??Extensive experience in different test automation tools and technology. ??Experience in creating and maintaining automated tests for REST APIs. ??Solid understanding of testing pyramid and experience in implementing it at  different levels. ??Experience working in a continuous integration and delivery environment. ??Working knowledge of product/defect/test case management systems. ??Advanced SQL with a solid understanding of database structures. ??Attention to detail, taking nothing for granted. This is a technical role and as such you will need a broad technical knowledge including, but not limited to, the following areas: ??SQL ??Azure Data Services (SQL, Data Factory, Databricks) ??Power BI ??Python ??Azure DevOps ??Business Objects ??Crystal Reports ??Azure DevOps ??Git

column1: Offering Development Specialist - Data Analysis, Reporting & Insights
column2: Org:Growth and Strategy Activation & Enablement Role:Data Analysis, Reporting & Insights Level:9 Company Description Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world's leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services creating tangible value at scale. We are a talent- and innovation-led company with approximately 743,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360 value, enable us to help our clients reinvent and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360 value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at . Our strategic intent  As part of transforming Accenture's go-to-market agenda and to be able to bring the best of Accenture to every client, every time and everywhere, we build and activate Solutions, which are Industry-led, multi-service, asset-powered propositions, in digital format, anchored in our clients' most strategic and pressing issues. Our stakeholders include senior leaders within Accenture leading various functions/industries/services/practices, solution leadership (e.g., Assets & Solutions Champions, Global Solution Leads), and Client Account Leads and account teams who directly interface with our clients. We offer each talent an exceptional career experience by giving individuals the opportunity to inspire, innovate and make an impact for our Clients, Communities, and people. We are always looking for people to push themselves further, have the passion to collaborate, deliver value and help us reach our common goals. Role Description The role sits on the Global Activation & Enablement team which is part of Assets & Solutions group reporting to Accenture's Chief Assets & Solutions Officer. This is a full-time role in Data Analysis, Reporting, and Insights. The individual will work closely with various Activation Leads and cross-functional teams to translate Senior Leadership business requirements into effective reports, dashboards, and data models, to measure progress and help drive strategic decisions. Recipients of the reports and insights include Chief Assets & Solutions Officer, Market CEOs, Group Chief Executives, Industry/Function Leaders, etc. Key Responsibilities The candidate will be responsible for the following in their job role: Drive data management and analysis efforts for the Global Activation & Enablement team. Evolve the analytics and reporting capability to identify, collect, organize, and analyze data for key activation and business metrics. Create insightful business reports / dashboards for Senior Leadership stakeholders. Incorporate new ways of working including automation of the reporting structure. Proactively collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g. Asset Engineering, HR, Business Operations, etc.) to source data, develop models, and build scalable and automated dashboards (using Power BI) Highlight and address data quality issues while ensuring data security and privacy and compliance with Accenture's policies and standards. Qualification Required Work Experience & Skills Minimum 5 years of relevant experience Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field Should be familiar with data management practices, including data quality assessment, data integrity, data security and confidentiality Hands-on experience with reporting, dashboards, and insight-driven approaches Exposure to building data warehouses & designing data architecture. Should have knowledge of dashboarding tools like Power BI. Strong data handling, interpretive, and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with multiple data sources, process large volumes of data and efficiently derive insights / actionable results. High energy and ability to adapt to an evolving operating model and changing ways of working. Ability to work both independently and as a team member. Have a results oriented' and a go get it done' attitude. Location:NCR, Bangalore, Mumbai

column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making that will allow us to tackle some of the world s greatest health threats.      Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management.      Deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.      In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. As we endeavour, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of    Analyst - Reporting       We are looking for a team member to support our analytics team based out of US. Robust analytics is a priority for our businesses, as the product potential has major implications to a wide range of disciplines. Process:     Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the medical writing group, including scientific documents and clinical/medical reports     Contribute to overall quality enhancement by ensuring high scientific standards for the output produced by the medical writing group; and     Secure adherence to compliance procedures and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with all applicable standards     Refresh report on frequency/cycle basis (weekly / monthly / quarterly / annually) ,  along with QC checks for each refresh     Ensure on time and accurate delivery of all analytics and dashboard requirements     Ensure data quality and consistency is maintained throughout the lifecycle of tracker/dashboard     Pro-actively identifying analytical requirements     Assist in managing medical plans in project management system     Reporting and follow ups on Project Management activities, project resources, budget, and timelines     Understanding analytical requirement of all relevant stakeholders and develop solution accordingly     Continuously exploring the new features and add on, assess different tools to improve the overall performance in a cost-effective way     Managing access for Smartsheet trackers and Dashboard     Developing SOPs for dashboards and other analytical needs elements (hotspots, links, etc)               About you         Experience: 3+    years experience with analytical tools such as (Advanced Excel & Power BI). In-depth knowledge of common databases like IQVIA, APLD, Engagement and execution data, etc            Soft skills   : Strong learning agility; Ability to manage ambiguous environments, and to adapt to changing needs of the business; Good interpersonal and communication skills; strong presentation skills a must; Team player who is curious, dynamic, result oriented and can work collaboratively; Ability to think strategically in an ambiguous environment; Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones; Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques.            Technical skills   :     Experience of developing and managing dashboards     Excellent planning, design, project management and documentation skills     Strong project management abilities; capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously     Proficiency of programming languages (eg SQL, SAS, Python, R, VBA)     Strong experience using analytical platforms (eg Databricks, Jupyter Notebook, SQL developers, etc)      Experience with pharmaceutical data sources and CRM data systems (eg IQVIA, Symphony, Komodo, Veeva, Salesforce)      Experience of using analytical tools like Power BI, Qliksense, Tableau, Smartsheet, and Alteryx etc;      Expert knowledge of Excel and proficiency in VBA      Experience of developing and managing dashboards      Project management abilities; capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously      An aptitude for problem solving and strategic thinking      Ability to synthesize complex information into clear and actionable insights      Proven ability to work effectively across all levels of stakeholders and diverse functions      Solid understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, supply chain and marketing functions      Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques                Education   : Bachelor s or Master s degree in areas such as Information Science / Operations / Management / Statistics / Decision Sciences/Engineering/Life Sciences/ Business Analytics or related field (eg, PhD / MBA / Masters);            Languages   : Excellent knowledge in English and strong communication skills - written and spoken

column1: Analytics Senior Analyst - Marketing and Customer Analytics
column2: Skill required:Marketing and Customer Analytics - Data Science  Designation:Analytics Senior Analyst  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:MTech/MSc/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience:5 to 8 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Insights & Intelligence vertical and help us generate insights by leveraging the latest Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Analytics techniques to deliver value to our clients. You will also help us apply your expertise in building world-class solutions, conquering business problems, addressing technical challenges using AI Platforms and technologies. You will be required to utilize the existing frameworks, standards, patterns to create architectural foundation and services necessary for AI applications that scale from multi-user to enterprise-class and demonstrate yourself as an expert by actively blogging, publishing research papers, and creating awareness in this emerging area. You will be working as a part of Marketing & Customer Analytics team which provides a set of processes that measure, manage and analyze marketing activities in order to provide actionable insights and recommendations to marketing organizations in terms of optimizing ROI & performance efficiency in operations. Customer analytics is a process by which data from customer behavior is used to help make key business decisions via market segmentation and predictive analytics. This information is used by businesses for direct marketing, site selection, and customer relationship management. You should have exposure to digital marketing, A/B testing, MVT, Google Analytics/Site Catalyst. In this role, you will be working on the interdisciplinary field about scientific methods, processes and systems to extract knowledge or insights from data in various forms, either structured or unstructured. Prior experience in one or more of the analytics areas (price modeling, promotion forecasting, demand forecasting, supply chain analytics, markdown optimization, assortment analytics, affinity analysis, recommendation engine, etc.) will be good. Require excellent knowledge in multivariate statistical techniques (regression, classification, segmentation, etc.)  What are we looking for? Python  R Language and Environment  Microsoft Power BI/QlikView  Commitment to quality  Strong analytical skills  Written and verbal communication  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders  Ability to meet deadlines Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  May create new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person would require understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor  May interact with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  Guidance would be provided when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions made by you will often impact the team in which they reside  Individual would manage small teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: As a Customer Success Insights Analyst, you are responsible for providing analytical expertise to support key strategic and operational initiatives for our Customer Success Organization.                                                      Analysts use a range of statistical methods, algorithms, and analysis techniques to advise business leaders on strategy and identify opportunities to optimize business processes, customer experiences, and offerings. You will work closely with business stakeholders to distill your analysis into actionable insights and recommendations.                                                     You will join Commercial Customer Success team.                                                      You will report to Manager, Strategic Planning/Analytics.In Commercial Customer Success, we drive growth through irresistible customer experiences.                                                      For us, growth is two things: A focus on increasing retention and renewals rates and identifying opportunities for expansion to pass to our sales partners.                                                      With Resellers, we are accelerating customer retention performance and revenue growth by developing and maturing their Customer Success and Services practices. As part of the team, you will work on programs that impact Commercial Customer Success overall, and the specific functional area that you support.                                     Roles & Responsibilities           Serve as an analytics business partner - supporting business stakeholders with in-depth analysis, continually mining for insights to drive operational improvements         Conduct research from problem definition through execution of analysis. Highlight potential areas of concern for senior management based on your analysis         Assess impact of business strategies and provide clear articulation of analysis to support decision-making for senior management         Build sophisticated qualitative and quantitative analyses, including advanced modelling, that translate raw data into insights that can be turned into relevant recommendations and built into reports and dashboards         Be the data subject matter expert for the area of the business you support - understanding dataset structure, data quality, and appropriate analysis use cases         Understand existing data models and identify and document areas for improvement to contribute to the overall Autodesk data infrastructure               Minimum Qualifications           3-5 years Relevant Work Experience in the data analytics field         Experience in a similar role or a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or related field         Proficiency in writing and optimising SQL queries and working with large datasets         Working knowledge with visualisation tools (PowerBI, Qlikview, etc         Have experience working with a modern data warehouse ( Snowflake)         Microsoft Power BI Certification         Experience supporting Customer Success or Renewals organisations               The Ideal Candidate           you're a true data expert - you can creatively mine multiple different datasets to gain insights and answer business questions         You are curious - curiosity fuels your use of problem solving and analytical         You want to understand customer success - you're not just satisfied with building a cool model, you also want to make sure its relevant in the field         You tell compelling stories using data - you weave together a narrative based on your analysis of what is happening in the business, why it is happening and why it matters and can present your findings to both experts and general audiences         You are a partner - you are communicative and empathic with stakeholders and business leaders to determine how to best answer their questions through analysis

column2: Overview NRM strategy Playbook - Associate plays a pivotal role in our organization, with a primary focus on brand ladder and price pack architecture analysis, Mix Management and Promo Strategy. This role encompasses a range of responsibilities related to optimizing our product and pricing strategies to maximize brand equity, profitability, and consumer engagement.  Key responsibilities of the Brand Ladder / Price Pack Architecture (PPA) Playbook - Associate include: Conducting in-depth market research and data analysis to identify and evaluate brand positioning / price pack architecture opportunities Analyzing consumer behavior and preferences to gain insights into how our brand ladder / pricing strategies impact purchasing decisions Developing and refining brand ladder and PPA models and methodologies to streamline decision-making / enhance operational efficiency Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure that our brand and pricing strategies align with overarching business objectives and regulatory requirements Utilizing data-driven insights to enhance the overall consumer experience and perception of our brands and pricing structures Contributing to the long-term brand and pricing strategy of the organization, actively participating in the creation of innovative approaches to optimize brand equity and profitabilityThe Brand Ladder / Price Pack Architecture (PPA) Playbook - Associate leverages advanced analytical skills and tools to shape our brand and pricing strategies, ensuring they are aligned with our strategic goals, compliance standards, and customer satisfaction objectives Responsibilities Functional Responsibilities Perform advanced analytics using Tableau/Power BI and develop predictive models, regression modeling, price elasticity analysis, and promotion optimization to extract actionable insights from data Collaborate on sector NRM strategic projects, such as promotions optimization, terms priorities, competitor benchmarking, and Price Pack Architecture (PPA) initiatives, to drive revenue realization Conduct statistical and trend analysis to identify market opportunities, highlight sector strengths, and provide recommended corrective actions to enhance performance Monitor existing KPI metrics, develop new relevant metrics, and identify correlations and root causes to support data-driven decision-making Design and build visualization dashboards to accelerate information-to-action at scale, enabling easy access to critical insights for various stakeholders Develop programs, methodologies, and reports for analyzing and presenting data, making data-driven insights accessible and actionable Ensure the timely and accurate submission of reports and data to the Revenue Management teams in line with agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA) Improve the utility of operational and performance data within various teams, supporting Business Intelligence (BI), reporting, analysis, and insights efforts Assist the GBS Commercial lead in developing an ongoing training and capability plan for COE associates, ensuring continuous growth and expertise development within the team Qualifications Broader data analysis capabilities. Previous experience in Consumer Insights, Key account Management, Trade Marketing or CPG consulting Experience in pricing and promotions management, demonstrating a deep understanding of pricing strategies, market dynamics, and consumer behavior Proven experience working in the Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) sector with a strong understanding of business processes related to Revenue Management, including promotions, pricing, and sales Excellent visualisation skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable solutions and processes, enabling data-driven decision-making  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a strong command of PowerPoint, with the ability to quickly learn various in-house software applications for data analysis and reporting Working knowledge of Power BI software is added advantage Ability to function effectively in a team environment and collaborate with individuals across the organization, as pricing and promotions strategies often require cross-functional teamwork Good verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders and present findings and recommendations in a clear and compelling manner

Data collection, report design, creation and dissemination of relevant reports to management             Collate, analyze and interpret financial data             Ad-hoc reporting and analysis             Identify and drive process improvements within FP&A. Automation know-how, proficiency in advanced MS Excel / VBA / Access, Google Sheets, Power BI(Good to have). column2: This position will be within Marketing, Grant Thornton INDUS in the Market Intelligence Center of Excellence (MICOE) team, with the purpose of informing strategic marketing decisions that drive brand health, customer engagement, and revenue growth.           Duties and Responsibilities           Responsible for researching, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting market intelligence data related to markets, customers, competitors, economics, operations, and our own marketing performance - and translating into action.           Specific responsibilities include:             Conduct market research and data analytics projects to gather intelligence to better understand the voice of our customers/target buyers (eg, priorities, feelings, needs, preferences, behaviors).     Gather competitive intelligence, analyze competitor landscape data, examine competitors marketing, brand positioning, and ads, and make recommendations to improve our competitive advantage.     Conduct both secondary and primary market research using both qualitative and quantitative data.     Learn and leverage analytics tools and technology platforms to collect and analyze data (eg, MS Excel, Power BI, SQL, Alteryx, Python, SimilarWeb).     Aggregate and synthesize vast amounts of qualitative and quantitative data and translate into simple, digestible reports with executive summaries and actionable market insights.     Develop polished PowerPoint presentations, tables, and charts to communicate data stories to both executive level stakeholders and the larger marketing organization.     Apply critical thinking to understand a request or hypothesis, identify appropriate data sources and market research methods to answer requests, analyze and communicate results.     Support formulation of questions for focus groups and surveys and synthesize results into summaries and actions.                 Qualifications and Requirements              Successful candidate will have the ability to produce requested research and analysis, but also think creatively to provide deep actionable insights and recommendations to inform marketing strategy.     Masters degree with 1 to 2 years of relevant work experience in market intelligence, market research, customer insight, competitive analysis, data analytics, and reporting     Strong PowerPoint, executive level writing, and verbal communication skills.     Strong Microsoft Excel skills.     Experience with data analytics tools, such as Microsoft Power BI, SQL, Alteryx, Python, or SimilarWeb is a plus.     Strong attention to detail and deadline oriented.

column2: The ability to collect, analyze and interpret scientific/business information relevant to the identification of early investment/partnering opportunities is critical to inform the Lilly Venture Science teams strategy      The LRL Venture Science Consultant provides analysis and insight on a variety of technologies, scientific concepts, companies, and assets that are of interest to our overall ventures and business development organization      The core of the Venture Science Consultant role is to be a trusted and valued business partner who has deep technical information and data expertise along with a strong analytical skill set      The Venture Science consultant will partner with the venture science and business intelligence teams to provide expertise in intelligence research and analysis that informs Lillybroader investment strategy                    Responsibilities:            Collaborate with the venture science teams to identify areas of specific interest to build landscapes and other evergreen reporting mechanisms that inform strategic decisions.      Identify relevant and reliable sources of data/information or surrogate information sources and assimilate it quickly into useful formats to inform broader venture strategy.      Apply analytical and creative problem-solving skills to bring data from multiple sources together and contextualize for research/business meaning. Projects may include, but are not limited to, landscapes (target, disease, clinical, or technology), pipeline analyses, company profiles, general surveillance.      Identify and suggest alternative paths of inquiry for challenging questions. An inquisitive mindset and a passion for investigating hard-to-find information when addressing questions with ambiguity and uncertainty is necessary.      Be able to provide and defend gathered intelligence, methodology, content, and conclusions to leadership in a clear, concise format.      Work collaboratively within the Business Development Intelligence team to prioritize work and deliver on time-sensitive requests.Including collecting and managing internal data as well as authoring on internal reports for senior leadership.                Basic Qualifications/Requirements:            Advanced degree/PhD in life sciences domain, scientific, or health-related field (Pharma/Biotech).      5-10 years of experience in scientific or pharmaceutical intelligence roles.      Excellent organizational skills; able to manage multiple projects and juggle conflicting priorities in an ambiguous environment.          Demonstrated high learning agility; able to quickly grasp new concepts and absorb large amounts of information under pressure.      Ability to simplify complex information and concepts in a clear, concise and digestible format so the reader can quickly understand the content and conclusions of the analysis.      Excellent communications skills in the form of oral presentation as well as other mediums (Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint).                Additional Skills/Preferences:            MBA or equivalent business development experience with focus on business development activities.      Relevant scientific or intelligence experience in one or more research areas of interest for Lilly (genetic medicines, digital health, devices, connected care, diabetes, oncology, immunology, neurodegeneration, pain, discovery chemistry).      Experience with artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing, or designing user interfaces.                Soft Skills:            Strong work ethic, personal motivation, and team player who is dynamic and result oriented.      Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones (true global team base).      Strong desire to build and own their personal brand as the interact across a dynamic team.
