We understand the vision and mission of our customers & help them by developing innovative AI Strategy with value driven use cases, roadmap & technological solutions that drive business growth and innovation. As a key pillar of our organization, the Engineering Products team worked on various fields from data & AI perspective- Data Strategy, AI Strategy, Data Modelling, Data Architecture, Cloud Assessment, Industry & AI Value strategy etc. that helps our customers in setting up strong data platform foundation & target roadmap to scaling & evolve towards achieving AI/GEN AI & advanced analytics vision to meet the evolving future needs of technology advancement. What you would do in this role Participate in visioning workshop & develop innovative AI strategy & architecture frameworks tailored to the unique goals and aspirations of our clients, ensuring alignment with their evolving needs and preferences. Conduct comprehensive evaluations of clients' existing processes, technologies, and data ecosystems, uncovering opportunities for AI integration that resonate with Gen AI values and lifestyles. Align with industry & function teams, understand business problems, and translate it to AI & Analytics solutions! Develop target strategy with respect to AI & GEN AI needs along with Key initiatives & roadmap. Propose best suited LLMs (Large Language Model-GPT 3.5, 4, Llama etc.) as per the selection criteria framework & serve as a trusted advisor to our clients, offering expert guidance on AI & GEN AI adoption strategies that resonate with Gen AI values of inclusivity, sustainability, and ethical responsibility. Work closely with cross-functional teams to co-create and implement innovative AI & Gen AI solutions that address the complex challenges faced by customers and businesses. Participate in client engagements with confidence and finesse, overseeing project scope, timelines, and deliverables to ensure seamless execution and maximum impact. Facilitate engaging workshops and training sessions to empower AI Client stakeholders with the knowledge and skills needed to embrace AI-driven transformation. Stay abreast of emerging AI and analytics trends and technologies, continuously improving internal capabilities and offerings. Participate in AI/GEN AI and Analytics aligned solutions and client demos. Lead exploratory data analysis to uncover insights and prepare data for predictive modeling. Design, develop, and deploy AI models to solve complex business problems, enhancing operational efficiency and creating new opportunities. Qualification Who are we looking for? Years of Experience: Candidates should typically have at least 5-8 years of experience in AI strategy, management, or a related field. This experience should include hands-on involvement in developing and implementing AI strategies for clients across various industries. Education: A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field. Add eligibility: Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills are essential for this role. Candidates should be able to assess clients' business processes, technologies, and data infrastructure to find opportunities for AI integration and develop tailored AI strategy frameworks aligned with clients' goals. Displayed expertise in artificial intelligence technologies, including machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and deep learning. Candidates should have a solid understanding of AI concepts, algorithms, and their applications in solving real-world business problems.  Excellent communication and presentation skills are crucial for effectively articulating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Candidates should be able to convey AI strategy recommendations in a clear, concise, and compelling manner. Knowledge of cloud computing services (AWS, Azure, GCP) related to scaled AI and data analytics solutions. The ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams is essential for this role. Candidates should be comfortable working with diverse teams to design and execute AI solutions that address clients' business challenges and deliver measurable results. Candidates should have a strong understanding of Gen AI preferences, behaviors, and values. Candidate should have understanding & working knowledge of various large language models to propose and implement best suited LLMs to our customer based on AI strategies that resonate with Gen AI Working experience with machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.  Knowledge on MLOPs tools and services from strategic mindset will be a plus. Working knowledge in the AI and Analytics lifecycle, including problem definition, data preparation, model building, validation, deployment, and monitoring. Desired experience. Minimum 6 years of experience working with clients in the products industry (Lifesciences, CPG, Industry & Ret that are heavily influenced by AI & Gen AI preferences and behaviors, is highly valued. Candidates who have a deep understanding of AI & Gen AI trends and market dynamics can provide valuable insights and strategic guidance to clients. Minimum 5 years proven experience & deep expertise in developing and implementing AI strategy frameworks tailored to the specific needs and aims of clients within LS, Industry, CPG, and Retail sectors. The ability to craft innovative AI solutions that address industry-specific challenges and drive tangible business outcomes will set you apart. Minimum 6 years strong consulting background with a demonstrated ability to lead client engagements from start to completion. Consulting experience should encompass stakeholder management and effective communication to ensure successful project delivery. Minimum 4 years strong working experience AI implementation lifecycle & working knowledge in the AI and Analytics lifecycle, including problem definition, data preparation, model building, validation, deployment, and monitoring. Tools & Techniques Knowledge on Cloud and native services around AI & GEN AI implementation-AWS/Azure/ GCP Have worked hands on Programming languages such as Python, R, SQL or Scala. Working knowledge AI and analytics platforms and tools, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, KNIME, or similar technologies Working Knowledge on NLP (Natural Language Processing) techniques-text summarizer, text classification, Named Entity Recognition etc. Working Knowledge on various machine learning models-Supervised unsupervised, classification, regression model, Reinforcement learning, Neural networks etc., Knowledge on LLMs-Open AIGPT, Llama Index etc. Knowledge of ML Ops deployment, process tools & strategy (ML Flow, AWS Sage maker etc. Knowledge of UI/UX design using React, Angular & Visualization tools-Power BI/Tableau/Qlik Sense

column2: Roles and Responsibilities: This is an opportunity to join the Analytics organization of HP Inc and responsible for supply chain planning and analytics of print business unit. Analytics hosts planning activities for WW Supply Chain Operations and provide analytics and operational expertise to drive fact-based strategic and tactical supply planning, manage and execute forecast improvement initiatives by leveraging advanced analytics through simulation, modelling, optimization techniques & predictive analytics. The team work closely with various business units, regions, functions and manufacturing partners across multiple domains. Exposure to advanced analytics/optimization techniques and experience in analytics tools like R and Python will be an added advantage. Shift - No shift premium (India)

column2: Building on our past.  Ready for the future              Worley is a global professional services company of energy,  chemicals and resources experts.  We partner with customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their assets.  We re bridging two worlds,  moving towards more sustainable energy sources,  while helping to provide the energy,  chemicals and resources needed now.               Worley Consulting,      the independent consulting arm of Worley,  provides a true end-to-end offering for customers integrating strategy,  management,  and technical consulting expertise with deep domain knowledge,  backed by real-world experience.                    Our global consulting group is growing rapidly,  generating opportunities for high calibre professionals.  This is an excellent opportunity for a candidate with consulting experience,  strong communication abilities and knowledge of energy markets to grow their understanding and capabilities in the rapidly changing global energy,  chemicals,  and resources markets.                 This position will be based in the Worley Mumbai Office and will report to the Global Lead,  Worley Insights as part of the Growth group in Worley.                       Position : Graduate Management Consultant                                        Description of the position:                          We are looking for a self-driven,  curious,  and analytical consultant to be part of our global consulting team.   You will be part of the team of consultants providing consulting services as part of the global Worley consulting team,  as well as provide input into a suite of multi-client services provided by Worley.  We work in the Energy,  Chemicals and Resources sectors with a strong focus on sustainability,  the Energy Transition and the decarbonization of emissions intensive industries.                   Key responsibilities include:                              Team leadership of a team of consultants                              Provide consulting support to clients,  including technical modelling,  market analysis,  regulatory and policy analysis,  and economic modelling                              Data gathering,  analysis and modelling                              Economic trend analysis and forecasting                              Support and direct the development and maintenance of in-house market models and databases                    Key Candidate Attributes:                        Business Focus                                    Broad understanding of market drivers and trends,  industry structure,  production pathways,  plant operations and economics.                               Develops tools,  procedures,  and products to improve service delivery                              Uses an understanding of client businesses to tailor services for maximum positive impact                  Leadership                                    Organizing,  mentoring,  and training team members                              Keeps up with technical,  economic and market developments                              Proactively provides ideas and feedback to support tools and methodology improvements,  and business development activities to drive productivity and growth                              Motivated and self-driven                              Applies safety best practices to all aspects of the role                  Teamwork                                    Effectively communicates expertise to senior management,  peers,  team members and customers; facilitates communications across multi-party activities                              Values and utilizes the diverse background and skills available across Worley Consulting for the attainment of project and company goals                              Participates in projects through teamwork with other departments and with outside organizations                              Proactively makes knowledge readily accessible                  Skills and Market Expertise                                    Excellent communication skills and the ability to build and maintain customer relationships and industry networks.                               Capability as a consultant in energy markets,  commodities and the energy transition                              Able to synthesize market data,  global trends,  and customer information to create meaningful reports and forward-looking analysis.                               Strong understanding of hydrogen,  ammonia or battery materials is a plus.

column2: ABOUT US Affine is a global leader in professional services and solutions at the forefront of AI, data engineering, and cloud technologies. With our distributed team of over 500 analytics professionals across North America, Europe, and Asia, we are dedicated to enabling global enterprises to transform and innovate through the power of AI (Artificial Intelligence), data engineering, and cloud technologies. We offer exciting career opportunities for professionals seeking to make a significant impact. Our diverse team represents a rich tapestry of talent, expertise, and cultural backgrounds. As an Affine employee, you'll be part of a dynamic and inclusive work environment that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. Joining Affine means immersing yourself in a world of cutting-edge projects and solutions. We work closely with global clients spanning various sectors, including manufacturing, gaming, consumer packaged goods (CPG), media and entertainment, travel, and technology. As a member of our team, you'll have the opportunity to leverage your skills and contribute to transformative projects that shape industries and redefine the future. We believe in investing in our people and nurturing their growth. Affine is dedicated to your professional development and offers a range of learning opportunities, mentorship programs, and career advancement paths. We also encourage innovation and thought leadership through our strong connections with esteemed institutions like UC Berkeley and premier Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs), ensuring that you stay at the forefront of industry advancements. At Affine, we foster a culture of collaboration, where ideas are valued, and teamwork is celebrated. As you work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry, you'll be inspired to push boundaries, solve complex challenges, and make a lasting impact on the world. JOB DESCRIPTION Job Description: We are seeking a talented and motivated Consultant Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate complex findings to diverse stakeholders. As a Consultant Data Analyst, you will play a key role in providing actionable insights and strategic recommendations to our clients, helping them unlock the full potential of their data. Roles and Responsibilities: Complete accountability for delivering 1-2 projects from conception to implementation Managing the team of Associates and Senior Associates Interviewing client intelligently to learn important figures and gather requirements Managing project timing, client expectations and meeting deadlines Creating smart & impactful PowerPoint presentations Playing proactive role in business development (preparing sales collaterals, pitch documents etc.) and organization building (training, recruitment etc.) Presentation of final results to the client and discuss further opportunities within/outside the project along with maintaining documentation and reports Plan deliverables and milestones for the project that you are responsible for Provide business analysis and business area assessment Facilitate meetings within the team on regular basis Track and report team hours EXPERTISE AND QUALIFICATIONS Technical Competencies Required: Strong in SQL MS Excel Ad-hoc and Insights MSFT PowerPoint Visualization capabilities  Power BI, Tableau or any other Data Viz. Tool

column2: The Asset Servicing Pricing & Profitability team are responsible for supporting Client Service Delivery teams in winning new business which is accretive to the firm and in retaining and enhancing the profitability of existing client as well as partnering with Product Owners to agree product pricing strategies and guardrails.         Shift Timings:    12pm - 8:30pm IST (Following EMEA public holiday schedule)         ?       In this role, you'll make an impact in the following ways:          Pricing/Data/Deal Modeling and Analytics - Implement and build product and services pricing models. Provide costs and revenue control analysis and support. Develop pricing matrices/rate cards.     Review deals and create fee estimates to onboard clients and build out services for client.     Work collaboratively with internal teams, such as technology, finance, and client service delivery teams, to complete unit cost analyses, which are used to develop product pricing for products/services.     Assists with developing presentations that clearly articulate findings of unit cost analyses and how products/services will be priced.     Develops suggestions for structuring pricings to be more attractive and profitable and help determine margins. Work closely with client service delivery teams to improve/maintain profitable business, identify areas of revenue leakage.     Work closely with revenue billing services partners and ensure invoices and fee schedules have the right components captured to avoid revenue leakage.     Begin to build financial models, where required.     Maintain good hygiene around capture of management information and KPIs.     Support initiatives for process and policy improvement.     No direct reports. Responsible for less complex products and clients and contributes to the achievement of team objectives.         To be successful in this role, we're seeking the following:          Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.     5 -7 years of total work experience preferred.     Strong communication and negotiation skills required.     Experience in financial accounting, economics preferred.     Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative analysis in a business setting is preferred.     Advanced Excel skills required (Power Query, Power Pivot, VB & Large data set manipulation)

column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. Forecasting and analytics deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.          In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. Creating complex TM1 Planning analytics reports - Quick, Dynamic, and customized. Test and validate report working in TM1 web. Streamline and optimize forecasting collection and submission process.     Refresh Existing Reports and identifies improvement opportunities in reporting and BI tools and as needed structure / functionality with the latest insights as they become available.      Collaborate with Digital teams to enhance data access across various sources, develop tools, technology, and process to constantly improve quality and productivity. Refresh forecast model assumptions and as needed structure / functionality with the latest insights as they become available. Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the business teams. column2: Company Profile Merilytics,  an Accordion company, is a fast-growing analytics firm offering  advanced and intelligent analytical solutions to clients globally. We  combine domain expertise, advanced analytics and technology to provide  robust solutions for clients business problems. You can find further  details about the company at  https://merilytics.com . We  partner with our clients in Private Equity, CPG, Retail, Healthcare,  Media & Entertainment, Technology, Logistics industries etc. by  providing analytical solutions to generate superior returns. We solve  clients business problems by analyzing large amount of data to help  guide their Operations, Marketing, Pricing, Customer Strategies, and  much more. Position The Business  Manager at Merilytics is the primary point of contact for clients. (S)he  will understand the clients business challenges and deliver actionable  insights to aid the decision-making process. The manager will engage in  day-to-day communications with clients and oversee the project specific  analyst team. Location: Hyderabad Roles and Responsibilities The roles and responsibilities of a Business Manager will include the below: Define the analytical problem-solving process to provide actionable insights aimed at solving complex business problems. Understand  the business challenges and analytical requirements of the senior  management level stakeholders, while providing robust solutions. Lead  a team of analysts, who are expected to extract, dig into, and analyze  the data using the optimal tool for the specific client problem that you  are solving. Monitor performance and set up development action plans for your team. Follow our five core values Client First, Excellence, Integrity, Respect and Teamwork. Open to travel to the clients location, if required. Pre-requisites and skillsets required to apply for this role: Undergraduate degree (B.E/B.Tech.) from tier-1/tier-2 colleges are preferred. MBA degree from top tier colleges is preferred. Should have 3+ years of experience. Strong leadership & proactive communication to coordinate with the project team and other internal stakeholders. Ability to use business judgement and a structured approach towards solving complex problems. Experience in client-facing/professional services environment is a plus. Strong hard skills on analytics tools such as R, Python, SQL, and Excel is a plus. Why Explore a Career at Merilytics: High  growth environment: Semi-annual performance management and promotion  cycles coupled with a strong meritocratic culture, enables fast track to  leadership responsibility. Cross Domain Exposure: Interesting  and challenging work streams across industries and domains that always  keep you excited, motivated, and on your toes. Entrepreneurial  Environment: Intellectual freedom to make decisions and own them. We  expect you to spread your wings and assume larger responsibilities. Fun  culture and peer group: non-bureaucratic and fun working environment;  Strong peer environment that will challenge you and accelerate your  learning curve. Other benefits for full time employees: Health  and wellness programs that include employee health insurance covering  immediate family members and parents, term life insurance for employees,  free health camps for employees, discounted health services (including  vision, dental) for employee and family members, free doctors  consultations, counsellors, etc. Corporate Meal card options for ease of use and tax benefits Work dinners, team lunches, company sponsored team outings and celebrations. Reimbursement support for travel to office, as and when promulgated by the Company. Cab reimbursement for women employees beyond a certain time of the day Robust  leave policy to support work-life balance. Specially designed leave  structure to support woman employees for maternity and related requests. Reward and recognition platform to celebrate professional and personal milestones. A  positive & transparent work environment including various employee  engagement and employee benefit initiatives to support personal and  professional learning and development.

Intelligent Insurance Operations combines our advisory, technology, and operations expertise, global scale, and robust ecosystem with our insurance transformation capabilities. It is structured to address the scope and complexity of the ever-changing insurance environment and offers a flexible operating model that can meet the unique needs of each market segment.Claims settlements related any client property they own or any accidentsIn this role, you will be managing workflow process and inventory handle policy maintenance inclusive of, contract amendments, customer & policy maintenance, broker of record changes. You will be managing terminations as needed in internal systems issuance of policy certificates to agents within desired timelines for Property, Auto, Workers Comp, Inland Marine, Travel and Marine Insurance (Commercial & Personal lines in the English Language) What are we looking for? - Individual with a bachelor's degree in quantitative field (Engineering/Science/Economics/Statistics) Must demonstrate interpersonal and communication skills along with analytical and logical approach Prior experience (7-12 years) in insurance/account modeling/financial modeling/specialized industry (Energy/Aerospace/Marine/Construction) is must Understanding of underwriting process flow Candidate must be self motivated and willing to learn more about insurance, reinsurance, risk management, project management, natural catastrophe, business dependencies-Knowledge of tools like excel, SQL, R-studio, python, visual basics, powerBI etc. is a plus Individual with a bachelor's degree in quantitative field (Engineering/Science/Economics/Statistics) Must demonstrate interpersonal and communication skills along with analytical and logical approach Prior experience (7-12 years) in insurance/account modeling/financial modeling/specialized industry (Energy/Aerospace/Marine/Construction) is must Understanding of underwriting process flow Candidate must be self motivated and willing to learn more about insurance, reinsurance, risk management, project management, natural catastrophe, business dependencies-Knowledge of tools like excel, SQL, R-studio, python, visual basics, powerBI etc. is a plus  Roles and Responsibilities:  - Working hand-in -hand with client underwriters (CUW) and support them with account overview based on respective Line of Business (LoB).-Working on propriety as well as vendor based models and tools Providing catastrophe modeling results to support the technical pricing and underwriting  Modeling one or more different policy structures per account, and multiple options as requested by the underwriter Independently manage QA/QC, Portfolio Validation including root cause analysis, identifying as well as implementing corrective measures. Manage team deliverables (key and critical service metrics)-Proactively communicating with Client underwriters about status of accounts in pipeline and prioritizing Adhoc/priority request-Resource and people management-Support with UAT and ideate/generate work around for tool limitations Assist seniors/managers to manage the team workload. Allocate/re-allocate the work based on the volumes. Actively participate in training of new joiners. Mentor team on processes and make them self-sufficient in managing work as per SLA Documenting assumptions and updating data and model dictionaries Qualification BE,BTech,Master of Business Administration

column2: Description & Qualifications  The Sr People Data Reporting Associate is part of a newly created HR Reporting team which falls under the HR People Insights team. This team is responsible for ad hoc and scheduled reports which will be approved according to a data governance approval matrix and delivered in a secure fashion. Reports may be required on a one-off basis or an ongoing scheduled basis. Key stakeholders/requestors include groups inside and outside HR and key approved partners and stakeholders outside UKG. Reference databases include UKG Pro, Visier, and other key HR systems.  This position will: Utilize BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms to extract and transform HR data from multiple sources including HRIS (Human Resources Information System), ATS (Applicant Tracking System), and other relevant databases. Select and design reports to provide the most appropriate HR fields to satisfy the user requests after reviewing and ensuring appropriate approvals are in place while meeting stated SLAs Develop and maintain automated processes for data extraction, ensuring accuracy and efficiency. Determine when reports should be created for self service, reoccurring or one time.  Job responsibilities New requests Review assigned tickets to ensure complete understanding of business request including timing and requested content Review requested content and requestor role to ensure data governance guidelines are met For requests that do not meet the existing requirements, reject with requirement to provide more business need/content for escalation review Determine if content/reports already exist in self-service or existing report or needs to be created  Design BI or other report to pull appropriate data and ensure QA completed and SLA met Provide to customer in secure fashion with scheduled follow-up where needed; upload to external sites or provide to vendors where needed. Ensure report is stored and labeled properly for continued use/review  Existing reports new users/new fields Review assigned tickets to ensure complete understanding of business request including timing and requested content Review content and requestor to ensure data governance guidelines are met Update reports with users/fields where needed  Scheduled (Recurring) reports Review scheduled reports quarterly and reach out to owner to check for modifications Ensure ongoing reports are being sent as scheduled to the appropriate users  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in HR, Business Administration, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. Proven experience as a Reporting Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role, preferably within an HR function. Proficiency in BI tools such as Cognos, Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms. Strong data management/manipulation skills Experience working with HRIS and ATS systems is desirable; experience with UKG Pro desired At least 3 years experience in Cognos reporting, Power BI visualization to deliver enterprise scale reports and dashboards or other Major BI platforms.  Knowledge of SQL database language and/or exposure to programming languages (R, SAS, Python, etc.) Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and quality. Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team environment. Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines/SLAs In depth knowledge and experience with MS Excel 3+ years experience in an operational reporting or analysis environment with a bachelors degree or in a related discipline in HR, L&D, Systems Analysis, IT or Finance or Analytics.
column11: Cognos reporting, data management, Power BI, SQL database, SAS, operational reporting, ATS systems, Cognos, Tableau, Python

column2: We are seeking a dedicated and analytical Customer Experience Analyst to join our team. The primary focus of this role is to drive improvements in Net Promoter Score (NPS) and Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) by monitoring, analyzing, and acting upon customer feedback. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of customer experience metrics and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.               ?         Roles and Responsibilities:             Monitor and report NPS and CSAT scores at various levels within the organization, including organizational, functional, and POD levels.         Conduct in-depth analysis of Dissatisfaction (DSAT) feedback and detractor responses gathered from CSAT and NPS surveys.         Produce comprehensive reports and presentations highlighting key findings and trends related to DSATs and detractors.         Initiate outbound calls to customers who have provided DSAT or detractor ratings, engaging in probing conversations to gather additional insights and feedback.         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to track and monitor the implementation of action plans aimed at improving the customer experience.         Provide recommendations for process improvements and initiatives based on data analysis and customer feedback.         Support ad hoc projects and tasks related to customer experience initiatives, as assigned by management.             Mandatory Qualifications:             Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Statistics, or a related field.         4-6 years of experience in a customer experience or analytics role, preferably within a customer-centric organization.         Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, with experience in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (eg, Tableau, Power BI).         Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and identify actionable insights.         Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present findings and recommendations clearly and persuasively.         Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.         Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and precision in data analysis and reporting.         Experience with customer feedback systems and survey tools (eg, Qualtrics, SurveyMonkey) is a plus.         Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively to meet deadlines and deliverables.
column11: Outbound, Loans, Data analysis, Customer experience, data visualization, CSAT, Analytics, Financial services, Monitoring, SQL

column2: As a Senior Services Consultant, you lead our agile project teams to accelerate our customers digital transformation and drive Celonis international expansion. You identify our customers strategic priorities and lead your project team towards developing data-driven process insights using SQL and creating complex data models to ensure that customers receive maximum value. You will become an expert in all kinds of company processes such as Finance, Order Management, Procurement, Warehouse Management, Customer Service, Production, e-Commerce, Opportunity Management, Supply Chain Management. You always leverage the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Analytics, Execution Apps, Process Automation, Real Time Data Ingestion, Task Mining and Machine Learning.          The work you ll do:         Lead and drive the implementation process while delivering exceptionally high levels of service to ensure the optimal solution for our customers with our Celonis technology      Transform the customer s data using SQL to create the data model for your process analysis     Design and implement innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms (Python) or Task Mining to make the customer s processes transparent and automated      Analyse the data to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes to jointly suggest approaches to overcome them     Quantify the business and financial potential and present the most relevant KPIs to the management      Translate business requirements into technical specifications     Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies      Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen         The qualifications you need:         Minimum 7 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement/Excellence or a similar area      Proficiency with SQL or other programming languages (Python, R, Matlab...) and a strong interest in Big Data, Data Analytics, Data Mining, and Process Mining     Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes     You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining and Execution technology forward      Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner     Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program           ?

column2: The fund expert is a member of the India Centre of Excellence (CoE) team functionally aligned to the Head of Fund Offering Management in Switzerland. Various fund-related data analytics tasks.                     Automation of various processes. column2: 3M seeks a Treasury Analyst to support its growing global operations     The person will work both within Treasury and with a diverse set of cross-functional stakeholders along with external banking partners     This position requires a self-starter who will work to support Treasury processes, perform financial analyses, and generate reports for senior Treasury management     The successful candidate should be comfortable with ambiguity, large data sets, and balancing multiple competing priorities     The role will require flexibility to work in various time zones                   Job Description Responsibilities:               Manage Level II (complex and non-standard) requests related to the user and bank account management processes. Helping in issuing Bank Guarantees basis request from business and others.     Perform ad-hoc analytical projects to support the Senior Treasury Analyst and other members of the Treasury team. Liaise with IT and provide support for testing and rollout of new software applications and upgrades. column2: Job description Manpower Resources India Pvt. Ltd., a leading Executive Search & Selection Company offer services to Manufacturing, Engineering, Infrastructure & Healthcare domain. We have been mandated by a large conglomerate into Metal and Mining business. We would like to discuss further to assess your suitability as per your convenience. About Company :  A large conglomerate into Metal & Mining business. Position Name: Business Analyst Location : Bhubaneswar Qualification : CA  Experience : 7+ Years   (Proficiency in financial modelling and valuation techniques)     Job Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst with a strong background in Chartered Accountancy (CA) and expertise in Merger & Acquisition, asset valuation, stock valuation, and equity valuation. The ideal candidate should have prior experience in venture capital, transaction advisory companies, or financial companies. This role requires a strategic thinker who can provide insightful analysis and support to growth and investment strategies. Key Responsibilities: Merger & Acquisition  (M&A): Conduct       thorough financial analysis and due diligence for potential M&A       opportunities. Evaluate       the strategic fit and financial impact of mergers, acquisitions, and       divestitures. Prepare       comprehensive M&A reports, including valuation models and risk       assessments. Collaborate       with legal, financial, and operational teams to facilitate smooth       transaction processes. Asset Valuation: Perform       detailed asset valuations for mining properties, including reserves,       machinery, and infrastructure. Utilize       various valuation methods (e.g., DCF, comparative market analysis) to       determine asset worth. Monitor       and update asset valuation models based on market conditions and       operational changes. Valuation of Stock: Evaluate       the equity value of the company for various financial transactions and       reporting purposes. Develop       and maintain equity valuation models, incorporating industry trends and       financial metrics. Assist       in preparing equity reports for investors, stakeholders, and regulatory       bodies. Valuation of Equity: Evaluate       the equity value of the company for various financial transactions and       reporting purposes. Develop       and maintain equity valuation models, incorporating industry trends and       financial metrics. Assist       in preparing equity reports for investors, stakeholders, and regulatory       bodies. Strategic Financial Analysis: Conduct       market research and competitive analysis to inform strategic       decision-making. Prepare       financial forecasts, budgeting, and scenario analysis to support business       planning. Identify       and analyze key financial metrics to drive business performance and       growth. Collaboration and      Communication: Work       closely with senior management, finance, and operations teams to align       financial strategies with business objectives. Present       findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise       manner. Support   cross-functional projects and initiatives, providing financial insights       and expertise. Desired Candidature: Chartered       Accountant (CA)  with Advanced degree in Finance, Economics,       Business Administration, or related field is preferred. Minimum       7 years of experience in a similar role within venture capital,       transaction advisory, or financial companies. Proven track record in       M&A, asset valuation, stock valuation, and equity valuation. Experience in the metal       mining industry is a strong advantage. Strong analytical and       quantitative skills with proficiency in financial modelling and valuation       techniques. Excellent knowledge of       financial principles, investment analysis, and market trends. Proficiency in financial       software and tools (e.g., Excel, Bloomberg, financial databases). Strong communication and       presentation skills. Ability to work       independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

column2: We are looking for an EPPM Analyst, who will play a pivotal role in supporting and enhancing our Enterprise Project Portfolio Management (EPPM) systems. You will be instrumental in administering, configuring, troubleshooting, testing, and integrating EPPM with other key platforms.   This position requires a blend of technical prowess, project industry insight, and effective communication skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to work effectively with diverse teams. Proven ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. This position requires adaptability to various working conditions and may involve travel The candidate must be capable of working in a collaborative virtual environment, maintaining productivity and effective communication despite geographical distances  Preferred candidate profile     1.  EPPM System Administration and Configuration:  Manage and configure Oracle Primavera P6, Oracle Primavera Cloud, Oracle Primavera Unifier, Procore, or similar systems.  Implement system updates, enhancements, and customizations to meet business needs. 2.  Troubleshooting and Technical Support:  Provide technical support for EPPM users, resolving issues related to system functionality, performance, and access.  Collaborate with IT and project management teams to troubleshoot complex problems. 3.  Testing and Integration:  Conduct thorough testing of EPPM configurations and integrations.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration with other key platforms, enhancing overall system efficiency and effectiveness. 4.  Stakeholder Interaction:  Regularly interact with business users to gather requirements, provide training, and gather feedback on system performance.  Coordinate with other IT resources to ensure alignment of EPPM strategies with broader IT objectives. 5.  Continuous Improvement:  Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in EPPM technologies. Recommend and implement best practices to improve system performance and user experience  Qualification: Bachelors degree in information technology, Construction, Software Engineering, or a related field Experience in the EPC project industry or supply chain is highly beneficial. Demonstrated experience using, administering, or configuring Oracle Primavera P6, Oracle Primavera Cloud, Oracle Primavera Unifier, Procore, or similar EPPM tools

column2: Skill required:Reporting & Insights - Reporting Analytics  Designation:Analytics and Modeling Analyst  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years Language - Ability:Japanese - Expert  What would you do? The Global People Analytics (GPA) team is made up of over 300 analytics, reporting, solution architecture, product owner, development, data science, and change management/training professionals around the world whose mission is to provide Accenture business and HR leaders with strategic and operational analytics and insights to enable data-led decision making. Proficiency in Japanese language and English is mandatory. The role involves but not limited to the following  Understand business requirements and translate into meaningful data analysis  Link the data findings to developments and known issues in the entity organization, and thus provide a preliminary interpretation/translation of data  Support global & entity programs/initiatives with creation of reports and scorecards, working with lead and system owners to determine data that should be used and how to report it  Leverage team members across HR TA&I to present a consolidated big picture to customers  Individual contributor and/or oversees a small work effort and/or team  Work with minimal supervision on daily tasks and moderate level of instruction on new assignments In Reporting and Analytics, you will have to prepare management reports and analysis, both recurring and ad-hoc. This includes focusing on tracking business performance through trusted data and insights while actively managing employee behaviors. Proficiency in Japanese language and English is mandatory. What are we looking for? Microsoft Excel  Microsoft Power BI  Effective Verbal Communications  Effective Written Communications  Data Analysis & Interpretation  Problem-solving skills  Strong analytical skills  Commitment to quality  Written and verbal communication Proficiency in Japanese language and English is mandatory Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems  Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture  You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments  Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others  In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Job Skill:Python (Programming Language)  Designation:Analytics Specialist  Job Location:Bengaluru  Qualifications:BE/BTech  Years of Experience:7 - 11 Years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Insights & Intelligence vertical and help us generate insights by leveraging the latest Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Analytics techniques to deliver value to our clients. You will also help us apply your expertise in building world-class solutions, conquering business problems, addressing technical challenges using AI Platforms and technologies. You will be required to utilize the existing frameworks, standards, patterns to create architectural foundation and services necessary for AI applications that scale from multi-user to enterprise-class and demonstrate yourself as an expert by actively blogging, publishing research papers, and creating awareness in this emerging area.You will be working as a part of Data Management team which is accountable for Data Management that includes fully scalable relational database management system. ETL(Extract, Transport and Load) - Set of methods and tools to extract data from outside sources, transform it to fit an organization`s business needs and load it into a target such as the organization`s data warehouse.The Python Programming Language team focuses on building multiple programming paradigms including procedural, object-oriented and functional programming. The team is responsible for writing logical code for different projects and take a constructive and object-orientated approach.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible,Agility for quick learning,Ability to work well in a team,Commitment to quality,Strong analytical skillsData Management,PySpark Roles and Responsibilities In this role, you need to analyze and solve increasingly complex problems. Your day to day interactions is with peers within Accenture. You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management. You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instructions on new assignments. You will need to consistently seek and provide meaningful and actionable feedback in all interactions. You will be expected to be constantly on the lookout for ways to enhance value for your respective stakeholders/clients. Decisions that are made by you will impact your work and may impact the work of others. You would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team.

column2: Skill required:  Business Reporting & Governance - Reporting Analytics Designation:  Analyst Qualifications: BCom  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 Years  What would you do? The Business Reporting and Governance vertical helps to deploy and deliver robust tracking mechanism for SLA/KPI or any other operations on a day-to-day basis. The Governance team will be responsible for contractual compliance of various aspects of contract like Governance, Reporting, Incident Management, Change Management and Survey Management along with driving automation and analytics. Effective communication and organization skills with Polished, professional presence Experience in working on automation projects  Demonstrate ability to achieve customer satisfaction through a managed service framework. Facilitation skills and Virtual teaming experience Adaptability to change. Effective collaboration skills and experience Adept in working across a heavily matrixed organization. Proficient in MS Office with advance knowledge in excel formulas. Ability to simplify and automate manual intensive processes using basic VBA, MS Access  Expertise in creating reports, and exposure to using PowerBI  Roles and Responsibilities:  Create and Publish Daily / Weekly / Monthly Reports on time with accuracy. Deliver ad hoc reports. Find trends in data to spot any anomaly / provide data insights to the stake holders. Automate reports to reduce manual efforts. Qualification BCom

column1: Data and Automation Analyst - Internal Audit
column2: The Data and Automation Analyst is a member of the Internal Audit team and will be responsible for financial and operational analytics, modeling, reporting, building automations, and business support for key parts of the organisation. This role requires in-depth business knowledge and advanced skills in data manipulation to translate business needs into insights and analysis as well as in building automations that solve business needs. This also includes assisting the IT audit team as needed. This individual will also create and maintain detailed business requirements, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for our business. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, highly analytical and detail oriented.          What will you do?          Perform detailed analysis of source systems and source system data, and model that data in a data visualisation tool (Tableau)      Create and maintain dashboards using Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server using a variety of sources      Perform ETL ( Extract-Transform-Load ) processes on large datasets      Manipulate large datasets, e.g. create complex joins and nested loops, for Tableau data source creations      Gather business requirements and propose BI solutions      Work directly with existing business units to define and create visual reports and dashboards for both all levels of business      Publish, analyse, and improve management information dashboards, operational business metrics decks and key performance indicators      Create interactive, drill-down dashboards and use stories, as appropriate      Design automated solutions for recurrent reporting (daily/weekly/monthly)      Contribute to the continued development of report automation and self-service distribution through Tableau and other platforms      Manage on-demand (ad hoc) requests to support the evolving needs of the business      Identify data quality issues and work with cross-functional team to correct issues      Use in-depth understanding of both data and visual sides of visualisation to deliver high quality work products that delight end users      Use in depth code-based knowledge to build automations (BOTs and Automated Workflows) that solve business needs in support Internal Audit and other key business users (Python, Jupyter, Alteryx, and other systems as needed)      Manage ongoing needs of automations      Perform IT testing (SOX/ IT Audits/ Operational Audits) as needed to support the IT SOX Team          What skills and knowledge should you bring?          Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other analytical field, or experience in an analytical role, required with at least 3+ years in consulting or similar developer/analyst position implementing Tableau dashboards, preferred      Practical knowledge of SQL and Python      Expertise in a data visualisation tool (Tableau or equivalent), required      Proven experience in development in BI tools (Tableau preferred)      Familiarity with Alteryx, nice to have      Excellent knowledge of SQL for performing data analysis and performance tuning      Proven experience in the development of automations (BOTs and Automated Workflows)      Expertise in an automation tool (Python, Jupyter, or equivalent)      Skilled with data analysis, data visualisation and reporting & analytics      Proven experience with IT Audit      Proficiency in MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio) software      Advanced Excel skills- using pivots, v-lookups, etc.      Ability to test and document end-to-end processes      Strong communication skills and willingness to take initiative to contribute beyond basic responsibilities along with the ability to effectively present to the target audience      Ability to take concepts from whiteboard to implementation      Ability to perform detailed data analysis, i.e. determine the structure, content, and quality of the data      Confidence, poise and diplomacy when interacting with all levels of management      Demonstrate integrity, values, principles, and work ethic      Collaborative approach to problem solving      Good organisational skills, attention to detail, accuracy, and a high degree of initiative      Strong customer focus; good listening, negotiation and problem-resolution skills      Ability to take direction, learn quickly, work independently, and maintain a level of professional skepticism
column11: Computer science, Data analysis, Manager Internal Audit, Automation, Analytical, Consulting, Data quality, Operations, Analytics, SQL

column2: The Power BI Developer / Analyst position combines in-depth business knowledge with expertise for analyzing data     The position is focused on building and maintaining data modeling and reporting tools to track business performance and aid in the decision-making process     This will include interactions with the Epiq Executive Team as well as with the Information Governance (IG) Delivery Team to prioritize business analysis needs for internal and external engagements     The information and analysis provided will guide the Epiq IG team as it relates to understanding KPIs and planning for future growth as well as for tracking external project metrics for reporting to clients     Developing and deploying dashboards for external client projects will be significant portion of the workload     This is a technical, hands-on delivery role requiring strong analytical skills with the ability to organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets with attention to detail and accuracy     The geographic scope for assigned tasks is potentially global with a primary emphasis on services delivered within North America             Job Responsibilities         Track financials daily     Prepare Power BI Dashboards and Excel reports on financials.     Prepare and audit project-based P&L through automation as compared to P&L report from Finance.     Report on other business KPIs from SAP, Salesforce, and Pulse     Manage tracking for key metrics for proprietary software products and projects.     Specialty Reporting for Epiq Senior Management and IG Management Teams     Hold Revenue tracking Sessions and summarize to IG team.     Collaborate with team members to determine best practices and client requirements for reporting.     Actively seek ways to improve business reporting processes and interactions. Improve engagement interactions.     Protects operations by keeping information confidential.     Contribute to strategic business initiatives within the information governance practice.     Perform administrative tasks that support the practice s objectives, as assigned.             Required Qualifications & Characteristics         3+ years experience as Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Process Specialist, or other roles where business functional requirements are captured and decomposed.         Experience: 3+ years of experience in application development     Proficiency in MS Office tools, particularly Excel     Proficiency with Power BI, including extensive experience in creating dashboards and visual analysis of datasets.     Power BI skills should also emphasize design aesthetics, with an ability to create visually appealing dashboards.     DAX experience needed. Write functions within Power BI     Experience with PowerShell scripting/Python - This is a plus.     Experience with databases and SQL syntax, ideally with Microsoft SQL Server     Understanding of data modeling and data organization     Ability to analyze data sets from external sources and map to an established relational data model.     Ability to learn quickly and work independently or as part of a team.     Exceptional problem-solving skills, technical acumen, and communication skills      Collaborative mindset and service orientation     Ability to work in an environment with deadlines and shifting priorities.     Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional, calm demeanor     Experience extracting data from non-database sources (XML, XLS, CSV file) Database sources (SQL Server) and developing visualizations by using Power BI     Must have data manipulation experience.      Experience with KQL is a plus
column11: Automation, SAP, Data modeling, Business analysis, XML, Application development, SQL, Python, Salesforce, Auditing

column2: Skills:  Must have - SQL, Python,R, AI/ML, Data Science,  commercial analytics, Omnichannel, Oncology, patient segment, Patient life cycle, patient analysis,  Good to have - US market healthcare knowledge,   Location: Chennai, Bangalore & Hyderabad  Responsibilities  Work on some of the latest applications of AI to solve complex business problems and demonstrate significant business value to one or more clients in the Pharma domain.  ??Lead project teams consisting of consultants, analysts, data scientists, ML engineers etc.   Closely engage with client stakeholders and onsite teams; participate in client workshops to identify high impact business problems that could be solved through AI based solutions.  ??Translate those business problems (sometimes ambiguous) into clear analytic problem statements.  ??Domain expertise in Pharma Industry or in Life Sciences / Us healthcare worked on Analytics consulting as a mandate.   Experience with cross therapeutically areas studies to meet Value Evidence and Real-world Evidence analytics needs.   Build machine learning and/or statistical models in Life sciences use cases such as predicting disease or treatment outcomes.  ??Develop thorough understanding of the Real-World Data (such as patient claims data, EMR, consumer data) and their use cases in pharmaceutical/health care research.   Knowledge of different retrospective RWD (Real World Data) databases such as Truven, Optum, Symphony etc.   Experience in bio-statistical techniques such as  Survival analysis.   Minimum 6 years of relevant work experience in delivering advanced analytics.
